commit_message:
Add node.resource_class

Related-Bug: #1604916
Change-Id: Ic5daf0d31207b7c123cb8b4228dae624383a48ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/40/345040/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Add node resource_class field ============================= https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1604916 Nova has a plan for scheduling Ironic resources the same way as other Nova resources, that involves making each Ironic node a "resource provider", which has a "resource class". That resource class is referenced by the Nova flavor, in short saying that the flavor requires exactly one thing from that resource class. When running the resource tracker, Nova must be able to associate each node with a resource class, which operators must be able to specify (because operators are the people creating the flavors and need to know how to associate the flavor). To allow for this, we add a new "resource_class" field to Ironic's node object. Problem description =================== Currently, Nova tracks Ironic resources with a (host, node) tuple. This causes a number of problems within Nova's internals, and the Nova team is trying to get away from this. At the same time, Nova wants to schedule Ironic instances the same way as other instances are scheduled. This allows Ironic to follow along in the ongoing scheduler changes, which will help reduce (or eventually eliminate) scheduling races, and benefit from other scheduler optimizations coming down the road (like making qualitative decisions more performant). Proposed change =============== The current proposal in Nova is to make each Ironic node a "resource provider", which is associated with a "resource class". A Nova flavor may declare that it requires some amount of a given resource class; in Ironic's case it would require one and only one. The resource provider record for a node will declare that it provides exactly 1 (or 0, if it is in maintenance or similar) of the resource class for that provider record. This proposal still allows nodes to be scheduled to based on qualitative properties, such as capabilities or affinity rules. To do so, Nova needs to know which resource class the resource provider record needs to be associated with. As operators manage the flavors that will be linked to these classes, we need a way for the operator to specify what class each node is in, so that the flavor is linked correctly. As such, we add a "resource_class" field to the node record in Ironic, which Nova will use when creating the resource provider record. As an example, imagine an ironic deployment has the following nodes:: - node-1: resource_class: ironic-gold properties: cpus: 4 memory_mb: 16384 - node-2: resource_class: ironic-silver properties: cpus: 2 memory_mb: 8192 capabilities: boot_mode: uefi The operator might define the flavors as such:: - baremetal-gold resources: ironic-gold: 1 extra_specs: capabilities: boot_mode:bios - baremetal-gold-uefi resources: ironic-gold: 1 extra_specs: capabilities: boot_mode:uefi - baremetal-silver resources: ironic-silver: 1 Note that the flavor definition is a strawman and may not be the actual keys used when this is implemented. A Nova user booting an instance with either the baremetal-gold or baremetal-gold-uefi flavor would land on node-1, because capabilities can still be passed down to ironic, and the resource_class on the node matches what is required by flavor. The baremetal-silver flavor would match node-2. Alternatives ------------ Keep doing the (host, node) thing long enough such that the Nova team decides they want to remove our driver from Nova, and subsequently remove the (host, node) tuple and break our driver horribly. Data model impact ----------------- Adds a "resource_class" field to the nodes table. This will be a VARCHAR(100) because that matches Nova's table structure. There will be data migrations provided for this change. The objects API will also take this change, with a corresponding version bump. State Machine Impact -------------------- None. REST API impact --------------- The new "resource_class" field will be exposed in the API, just like any other string field, with the same semantics. There will be a microversion bump, as usual. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- The client will be updated to add the field. "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ The CLI will be updated to add the field. "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The CLI will be updated to add the field. RPC API impact -------------- Only the objects changes mentioned above. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ No direct impact in scope here, but the new field will be used by the resource tracker in the future. Ramdisk impact -------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- After the deployment of the Newton version of Nova, deployers will need to populate the resource_class field in Ironic, and associate the flavors, before deploying the Ocata version of Nova. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- jroll Work Items ---------- * Add the field to the DB. * Add the field to the objects model. * Add the field to the API. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Unit tests should suffice here. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== No impact. Documentation Impact ==================== Add the new field to the API reference. References ========== To come.

commit_message:
Allow horizon to function without nova

Adds conditional block to nova quotas to exclude them if nova is not
enabled; adds 'permission' checks to the project overview and
access_and_security panels to only enable them if compute is enabled;
adds permission checks on compute and image to the admin overview
and metadef panels; disables 'modify quota' and 'view usage' project
actions; disables 'update defaults' if there are no quotas available.

The 'access and security' panel still appears (under Compute) but
tabs other than the keystone endpoint and RC download tab are hidden.

Closes-Bug: #1580116
Change-Id: I1b2ddee0395ad9f55692111604b31618c4eaf69e

commit_message:
Correct order of parameters in call to tune2fs

Under some systems this leads to an error if the oder of parameters
does not comply exactly with the way it is specified.

Change-Id: Ie1ff871dfffecaf95e7ac467b18543561aaa0ceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/61/345261/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
run_syntax_tests: add logic to find which puppet version to test

In Project Config, we dropped the logic that exported FUTURE_PARSER for
us, and we now do it in the run_syntax_tests.sh script.

Change-Id: I9aee6cf261722ed773058bc00b964e2f9d630e45

commit_message:
create securitygroup raises HTTPForbidden

create security group raises HTTPForbidden on
SecurityGroupLimitExceeded exception from
nov-api server.Because of that, novaclient
raises Forbidden instead of OverLimit exception.

Change-Id: Ied5fabdb2305b1f227e222ed329174f46c82c95b
Closes-Bug: 1566524

commit_message:
[WIP] libvirt: Update interface xml definition on migration

Portbinding for instance will be updated on pre_live_migration
instead of post_live_migration_at_destination. Doing so Neutron
will update the port with the required information for the
migration target. The libvirt driver can then query this
information and update the migration xml accordingly.

Change-Id: I76e29eb2e02dc96f0c317ca855dd0d76b5609184

commit_message:
Add 'all_state' value to 'notify_on_state_change' option

In the configuration doc, 'notify_on_state_change' means that "If set,
send compute.instance.update notifications on instance state changes."
Valid values are None, 'vm_state' and 'vm_and_task_state'. However, in
current implementation, if it's set to 'vm_state',
compute.instance.update notifications will be sent for all the state
changes and it will be a special state change notification when the vm
state changes. So as to 'vm_and_task_state'.

This patch introduces another valid value 'all_state' to get all the
compute.instance.update notifications. And if 'vm_and_task_state' is
set, we only send update notifications when vm state or task state have
been changed. The same with 'vm_state'.

Change-Id: Idd0ede7c297821590944d8b84f7bfa308c263bda
Closes-Bug: #1535254

subject: XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-19 02:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/migrate_data.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/volume_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1b1ddcd4e3e8ab08eae7bb6f3d8a538c126f212d', 'message': "XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration

Pass the volume-to-SR UUID mapping between live-migration source and
destination instead of assuming how the SR UUID is calculated from the
volume UUID and recalculating it (wrongly, in the case of old-style SR
UUIDs).

* Add volume_to_sr_uuids to XenapiLiveMigrateData object.
* Generate volume-to-SR UUID mapping by mapping volumes in the block
  device mapping to SRs associated with mount devices (ie device ->
  VBD -> VDI -> SR), also in the BDM, during source's
  live-migrate-check.
* Pass volume-to-SR UUID mapping down to the SR UUID determination
  function during destination's pre-live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie67646605946b9a7b929e1d9f3c4d6eb4fb19471
Closes-Bug: #1566622
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bob Ball <bob.ball@citrix.com>
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Handle old and new-style SR UUIDs during live-migration

Pass the volume-to-SR UUID mapping between live-migration source and
destination instead of assuming how the SR UUID is calculated from the
volume UUID and recalculating it (wrongly, in the case of old-style SR
UUIDs).

* Add volume_to_sr_uuids to XenapiLiveMigrateData object.
* Generate volume-to-SR UUID mapping by mapping volumes in the block
  device mapping to SRs associated with mount devices (ie device ->
  VBD -> VDI -> SR), also in the BDM, during source's
  live-migrate-check.
* Pass volume-to-SR UUID mapping down to the SR UUID determination
  function during destination's pre-live-migration.

Change-Id: Ie67646605946b9a7b929e1d9f3c4d6eb4fb19471
Closes-Bug: #1566622
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bob Ball <bob.ball@citrix.com>

commit_message:
Support unaddressed port

Remove the restraint of port-without-IP/net-without-subnet when VM creating.
It's part of the neutron blueprint vm-without-l3-address.

Depends-On: I5cd1fdfa13a7e57258be7251768eaa8ba64d486e
Close-Bug: #1039665
Implements: blueprint vm-boot-with-unaddressed-port

commit_message:
Don't return 300 for random urls

The osversions controller had this interesting idea that it would
return 300 multiple select if people attempted to get top level urls
without the version number in them. While this is ok in theory, it
doesn't validate that any of these urls actually exist.

As the resource structure from v2 and v2.1 on microversions evolves,
this is really not a concept that can be supported, and is unlikely to
be something that people are actually using (given that the result
links are fiction).

This removes this facility entirely.

Change-Id: Idd9b8877f2e31a75a204897c4e2be4838500a68b
Closes-Bug: #1567621

commit_message:
WIP: Raise VirtNotImplemented for ComputeDriver methods

Versioned objects, among other things, can raise NotImplementedError
which can be masked by code that's expecting and handling
NotImplementedError, like the compute manager and test_virt_drivers tests.

We should distinguish unsupported features in the virt driver from
actual lower-level failures so those don't get masked.

This adds a new type of exception for features that aren't implemented
in a virt driver. A few redundancies are removed from the hyper-v,
vmware and xenapi drivers since the base ComputeDriver class will
yield the same result.

Modify the FakeImage service so that created images always have
required attributes, which would be true if we were actually talking
to glance.

Ensure that os-consoles work as expected when VirtNotImplemented is
now raised.

TODO: we need to cover the VirtNotImplemented testing on the API side
before this can be merged. There is the start of a functional test to
do this, but it has to expand over more operations for this to be
ready.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: If73881270443335b991324ae6b61b1318d60f42d
Related-Bug: #1551925

commit_message:
[WIP] Make API error format conform to API-WG schema

Just a skeleton for implementing this feature is to help
reviewers understand it easily.

In the patch, only the following 4 aspects are involved.
1. Introduce BaseExceptionMeta into nova
2. Introduce a wrapper into nova
3. Enhance wsgi interface
4. Add wrapper for some APIs (e.g. detail())

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibc430660daa42c5c56fc37ef2bf1777952927a1e
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Depends-On: Iad0750c7294b4e5518ba55972ae519c6fcc6532b
Implements: blueprint error-codes-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/310662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Fujitsu, Limited # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import functools from nova.api import compute_req_id class BaseExceptionMeta(object): """Base Exception Meta. To correctly use this class, inherit from it and define the 'code', 'status', 'title', 'detail' and 'links' attributes. """ code = 'base.exception' status = 500 title = 'The base exception meta.' detail = 'This is the base exception meta.' links = [] def __init__(self, request_id, status=None, title=None, detail=None, links=None): self.request_id = request_id self.status = status or self.status self.title = title or self.title self.detail = detail or self.detail self.links = links or self.links def to_dict(self): """Convert BaseExceptionMeta object into a directory.""" meta = {'request_id': self.request_id, 'code': self.code, 'status': self.status, 'title': self.title, 'detail': self.detail, 'links': self.links} return meta class UnKnownMeta(BaseExceptionMeta): """A common meta information for the unknown ExceptionMeta.""" code = 'compute.api.unknown_code' status = 400 title = 'compute.api.unknown_code.title' detail = 'compute.api.unknown_code.detail' links = [{ "rel": "help", "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/"}] class Detail_Invalid(BaseExceptionMeta): """The meta information for Invalid which raised by detail().""" code = 'compute.detail.invalid' status = 404 title = 'compute.detail.invalid.title' detail = 'compute.detail.invalid.detail' links = [{ "rel": "help", "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/"}] class Detail_Permission_Denied(BaseExceptionMeta): """The meta information for Invalid which raised by detail().""" code = 'compute.detail.permission-denied' status = 404 title = 'compute.detail.permission-denied.title' detail = 'compute.detail.permission-denied.detail' links = [{ "rel": "help", "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/"}] class Index_Permission_Denied(BaseExceptionMeta): """The meta information for Invalid which raised by index().""" code = 'compute.index.permission-denied' status = 404 title = 'compute.index.permission-denied.title' detail = 'compute.index.permission-denied.detail' links = [{ "rel": "help", "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/"}] EXCEPTIONS = { 'compute.detail.invalid': Detail_Invalid, 'compute.detail.permission-denied': Detail_Permission_Denied, 'compute.index.permission-denied': Index_Permission_Denied, } def reraise_with_exception_metas(code): """Reraise exception after the metas are appended. This function is a wrapper for nova APIs, especially for the API there is no exception explicitly raised. :param code: a service-specific error code """ def decorator(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): try: return func(*args, **kwargs) except Exception as e: request_id = None if 'req' in kwargs: request_id = (kwargs['req']. environ[compute_req_id.ENV_REQUEST_ID]) if not hasattr(e, 'meta'): e = add_exception_metas(e, code, request_id=request_id) if hasattr(e, 'metas'): # we should always insert the meta into the index 0 to # keep the original exception stack. e.metas.insert(0, e.meta) else: e.metas = [e.meta] # the e.meta is only used to hold the exception meta # temporarily, so we should clean it after it was added # into e.metas e.meta = None raise e return wrapper return decorator def add_exception_metas(exc, code, *args, **kwargs): """Add exception metas into the exception. :param exc: the exception to be operated :param code: a service-specific error code :returns: the exception added exception metas. """ exc_cls = EXCEPTIONS.get(code, None) request_id = None if 'request_id' in kwargs: request_id = kwargs['request_id'] status = None if 'status' in kwargs: status = kwargs['status'] title = None if 'title' in kwargs: title = kwargs['title'] detail = None if 'detail' in kwargs: detail = kwargs['detail'] elif hasattr(exc, 'msg'): detail = exc.msg elif hasattr(exc, 'explanation'): # the exception belongs to webob only has 'explanation' attribute detail = exc.explanation links = None if 'links' in kwargs: links = kwargs['links'] if exc_cls: meta = exc_cls(request_id=request_id, status=status, title=title, detail=detail, links=links) else: meta = UnKnownMeta(request_id=request_id, status=status, title=title, detail=detail, links=links) exc.meta = meta return exc

commit_message:
[POC] Allow user defined stop

Expose 'type' for users when performing os-stop.

Change-Id: If92ec92f64dddda5a9f9e510e44f72eedafaabb7
Implements: blueprint allow-user-defined-shutdown-for-stop

added_lines: if api_version_request.is_supported(req, min_version='2.26'): try: clean_shutdown = not strutils.bool_from_string( body['stop']['force-shutdown'], default=False) except KeyError: clean_shutdown = True else: clean_shutdown = True self.compute_api.stop(context, instance, clean_shutdown=clean_shutdown)

commit_message:
Add PciDeviceList.save_batch()

This reduces us to a single RPC call to save N pci devices, from
N calls currently.

Change-Id: I3037788a4f0062f41282df8e714776ef3762b09a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/211288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock @mock.patch('nova.objects.PciDevice.save') def test_save_batch_pcidevicelist(self, mock_save): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() obj = pci_device.PciDeviceList() obj.objects.append(pci_device.PciDevice(id=1)) obj.objects.append(pci_device.PciDevice(id=2)) pci_device.PciDeviceList.save_batch(ctxt, obj) self.assertEqual(2, mock_save.call_count) @mock.patch('nova.objects.PciDevice.save') def test_save_batch_regular_list(self, mock_save): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() objects=[ pci_device.PciDevice(id=1), pci_device.PciDevice(id=2), ] pci_device.PciDeviceList.save_batch(ctxt, objects) self.assertEqual(2, mock_save.call_count)

subject: resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-28 10:52:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/44d0764db7555c341c5477e494709b0357bddabe', 'message': 'resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

There is an example illustrating the problem very well:
1. boot instanceA with anti-affinity policy server group, instanceA start
on hostA.
2. resize instanceA, instanceA was migrated to hostB, wait for verify
resize.
3. boot instanceB with the same server group, the instanceB was scheduled
to hostA because of anti-affinity policy.
4. resize-revert instanceA, the instanceA restart on the source
host(hostA).
5. the instanceA and instanceB run on same host (hostA), the anti-affinity
policy is broken

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-04 02:57:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4a8269d0f0d4d76ee35a590875ed6e1c3ea2cd39', 'message': 'resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-03-27 07:56:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f396bc7907924d734a40f005192cf94840c28318', 'message': 'resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

'}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2015-04-07 01:58:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/03fad720107d6287efb7eeb5c7a0de3cdb648b19', 'message': 'resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859

commit_message:
resize-revert can break anti-affinity policy

In order to resolve this problem, we can add the source compute node
into the anti-affinity servergroup when the instance has set the dest
compute node as its host. That is to say, when we setup the server group
in booting instance logic, the source and destination hosts of the
resizing/migrating instance should been add into server group hosts in
order to impact on the schedule of other instance with same server group.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I4c9877dbc41429ec24c04fff1558d33decc17842
Closes-Bug: #1425859
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/160110/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group_hosts = set() for instance in instances: # Add the source hosts which run the instances # in the migration progress for the bug: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1425859 for status in ['post-migrating', 'finished', 'reverting', 'reverted']: try: migration = objects.Migration.get_by_instance_and_status( context.elevated(), instance.uuid, status) except exception.MigrationNotFoundByStatus: pass if migration: group_hosts.add(migration.source_compute) if instance.host: group_hosts.add(instance.host) return list(group_hosts)
deleted_lines: return list(set([instance.host for instance in instances if instance.host]))

commit_message:
Add members in InstanceGroup object members field

In InstanceGroup object, add_members method doesn't add members
into object members field, which causes
objects.Quotas.count(server_group_members) won't increase, and
instance group quota check invalid.

Change-Id: I714c4d69815284a596cf80a23ca7b04d4e33b9c1
Closes-bug: #1538169

subject: config: consolidate console options within `console` group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-10 10:20:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/88931656e5700895e0d303f1b72b1dd9c6e42a53', 'message': "novnc: move config options into [novnc] group

Currently novnc config options reside in [DEFAULT] config group. This
is rather confusing, especially given the fact that some options have
very general names, e.g.:

    cfg.StrOpt('cert',
               default='self.pem',
               help='SSL certificate file'),
    cfg.StrOpt('key',
               help='SSL key file (if separate from cert)'),

One would probably expect such options to set SSL settings for other
subsystems of Nova, but instead those are used solely for novncproxy.

This change:

 - moves novnc config options into a new [novnc] group
 - adds ssl_ prefix to general config option names like cert and key
 - removes novncproxy_ prefix from option names as this is now covered
   by the config group name

oslo.config deprecation mechanism is used to provide compatibility
with existing config files. We might remove the deprecated names in
the future, though.

DocImpact

Backwards compatibility with existing config files is preserved by
the means of oslo.config, but operators are encouraged to use new
option names.

Closes-Bug: #1494207

Change-Id: I72883d63c2ff7273bb2e3a0a83d3418f112841d8

commit_message:
config: consolidate console options within `console` group

Console options currently reside in DEFAULT group. Many of those have
generic names (e.g. `daemon` or `record`) and may confuse people.
Move these into a separate group to denote the fact, that they are
used solely in console proxies. Also move novnc options there, as
those are actually common options for different console proxies, not
only novnc.

Options with prefix 'console_' are renamed to avoid tautology with the
config group name.

`cert` and `key` options are renamed to make naming consistent with
the remaining SSL option `ssl_only`.

Closes-Bug: #1494207

Change-Id: I72883d63c2ff7273bb2e3a0a83d3418f112841d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/222113/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_group('novnc', 'nova.cmd.novnc') if CONF.novnc.ssl_only and not os.path.exists(CONF.novnc.ssl_cert): exit_with_error("SSL only and %s not found" % CONF.novnc.ssl_cert) if CONF.novnc.web and not os.path.exists(CONF.novnc.web): exit_with_error("Can not find html/js files at %s." % CONF.novnc.web) source_is_ipv6=CONF.novnc.source_is_ipv6, cert=CONF.novnc.ssl_cert, key=CONF.novnc.ssl_key, ssl_only=CONF.novnc.ssl_only, daemon=CONF.novnc.daemon, record=CONF.novnc.record, traffic=CONF.verbose and not CONF.novnc.daemon, web=CONF.novnc.web,
deleted_lines: CONF.import_opt('record', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('daemon', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('ssl_only', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('source_is_ipv6', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('cert', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('key', 'nova.cmd.novnc') CONF.import_opt('web', 'nova.cmd.novnc') if CONF.ssl_only and not os.path.exists(CONF.cert): exit_with_error("SSL only and %s not found" % CONF.cert) if CONF.web and not os.path.exists(CONF.web): exit_with_error("Can not find html/js files at %s." % CONF.web) source_is_ipv6=CONF.source_is_ipv6, cert=CONF.cert, key=CONF.key, ssl_only=CONF.ssl_only, daemon=CONF.daemon, record=CONF.record, traffic=CONF.verbose and not CONF.daemon, web=CONF.web,

subject: Refactor claim code to eliminate duplication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-02 05:19:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a3d347d04d4f236f2bd47e0005253bfa03c79e89', 'message': "Refactor claim code to eliminate duplication

Remove the duplicated code in `nova.scheduler.claims` by refactoring
`nova.compute.claims`. The shared logics are abstracted to a new base
class `nova.compute.claims.ClaimBase`.

This refactoring only removes duplication, it doesn't change any logic
in scheduler nor compute service. So all existing tests can be passed
without change because there should be no regressions. And there are
also no new tests introduced because no features are added.

Change-Id: I753dc5a54c1ec17c6e7dd76ef270c5d485b74ca3
Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking

commit_message:
Refactor claim code to eliminate duplication

Remove the duplicated code in `nova.scheduler.claims` by refactoring
`nova.compute.claims`. The shared logics are abstracted to a new base
class `nova.compute.claims.ClaimBase`.

This refactoring only removes duplication, it doesn't change any logic
in scheduler nor compute service. So all existing tests can be passed
without change because there should be no regressions. And there are
also no new tests introduced because no features are added.

Change-Id: I753dc5a54c1ec17c6e7dd76ef270c5d485b74ca3
Implements: blueprint host-state-level-locking
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/262939/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from nova import exceptionfrom nova.i18n import _LIclass Claim(claims.Claim): # Stash a copy of the request at the current point of time self.spec_obj = spec_obj.obj_clone() self.claimed_numa_topology = None # Check claim at constructor to avoid mess code # Raise exception ComputeResourcesUnavailable if claim failed self._claim_test(self.host_state, limits) def disk_gb(self): return self.spec_obj.root_gb + self.spec_obj.ephemeral_gb def memory_mb(self): return self.spec_obj.memory_mb def vcpus(self): return self.spec_obj.vcpus def numa_topology(self): return self.spec_obj.numa_topology pci_requests = self.spec_obj.pci_requests if pci_requests and self.host_state.pci_stats: def abort(self): raise NotImplemented("There is no need to abort a claim in" " host state.") def _claim_test(self, resources, limits=None): """Test if this claim can be satisfied given available resources and optional oversubscription limits This should be called before the compute node actually consumes the resources required to execute the claim. :param resources: available local host state resources :returns: Return true if resources are available to claim. """ if not limits: limits = {} # If an individual limit is None, the resource will be considered # unlimited: memory_mb_limit = limits.get('memory_mb') disk_gb_limit = limits.get('disk_gb') vcpus_limit = limits.get('vcpu') numa_topology_limit = limits.get('numa_topology') LOG.info(_LI("Attempting claim: memory %(memory_mb)d MB, " "disk %(disk_gb)d GB, vcpus %(vcpus)d CPU"), {'memory_mb': self.memory_mb, 'disk_gb': self.disk_gb, 'vcpus': self.vcpus}) reasons = [self._test_memory(resources, memory_mb_limit), self._test_disk(resources, disk_gb_limit), self._test_vcpus(resources, vcpus_limit), self._test_numa_topology(resources, numa_topology_limit), self._test_pci()] reasons = reasons + self._test_ext_resources(limits) reasons = [r for r in reasons if r is not None] if len(reasons) > 0: raise exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable(reason= "; ".join(reasons)) LOG.info(_LI('Claim successful')) def _test_memory(self, resources, limit): type_ = _("memory") unit = "MB" total = resources.total_usable_ram_mb used = resources.total_usable_ram_mb - resources.free_ram_mb requested = self.memory_mb return self._test(type_, unit, total, used, requested, limit) def _test_disk(self, resources, limit): type_ = _("disk") unit = "GB" total = resources.total_usable_disk_gb used = resources.total_usable_disk_gb - resources.free_disk_mb / 1024 requested = self.disk_gb return self._test(type_, unit, total, used, requested, limit) def _test_vcpus(self, resources, limit): type_ = _("vcpu") unit = "VCPU" total = resources.vcpus_total used = resources.vcpus_used requested = self.vcpus return self._test(type_, unit, total, used, requested, limit) if pci_requests: if not self.host_state.pci_stats.support_requests( def _test_ext_resources(self, limits): return [] def _test_numa_topology(self, resources, limit): host_topology, _fmt = hardware.host_topology_and_format_from_host( self.host_state) requested_topology = self.numa_topology pci_requests = self.pci_requests if host_topology and requested_topology: pci_stats = None if pci_requests: pci_stats = self.host_state.pci_stats self.claimed_numa_topology = ( hardware.numa_fit_instance_to_host( host_topology, requested_topology, limits=limit, pci_requests=pci_requests, pci_stats=pci_stats)) if not self.claimed_numa_topology: if pci_requests: return (_("Requested instance NUMA topology together with" " requested PCI devices cannot fit the given" " host NUMA topology")) else: return (_("Requested instance NUMA topology cannot fit " "the given host NUMA topology")) def _test(self, type_, unit, total, used, requested, limit): """Test if the given type of resource needed for a claim can be safely allocated. """ LOG.info(_LI('Total %(type)s: %(total)d %(unit)s, used: %(used).02f ' '%(unit)s'), {'type': type_, 'total': total, 'unit': unit, 'used': used}) if limit is None: # treat resource as unlimited: LOG.info(_LI('%(type)s limit not specified, defaulting to ' 'unlimited'), {'type': type_}) return free = limit - used # Oversubscribed resource policy info: LOG.info(_LI('%(type)s limit: %(limit).02f %(unit)s, ' 'free: %(free).02f %(unit)s'), {'type': type_, 'limit': limit, 'free': free, 'unit': unit}) if requested > free: return (_('Free %(type)s %(free).02f ' '%(unit)s < requested %(requested)d %(unit)s') % {'type': type_, 'free': free, 'unit': unit, 'requested': requested})

commit_message:
libvirt, vhostuser: Add support for OpenContrail vRouter

OpenContrail vRouter can be used as a userspace DPDK based virtual switch
application that uses QEMU's vhost-user interface types. This requires adding
support for vRouter in {plug, unplug}_vhostuser() methods similarly as it is
done for OVS.

Change-Id: I8e8f76db8717c7621024b8947281a6f785f572dd
Implements: blueprint libvirt-vhostuser-vrouter-vif
Signed-off-by: Michal Dubiel <md@semihalf.com>

subject: Principle sends invalid config to hacluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 18:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-interface-hacluster/commit/13ad020e363006e947516bf10239f3ff834ba48d', 'message': 'Principle sends invalid config to hacluster

When requesting hacluster manage an init service the principle
sends options to hacluster but is currently erroneously sending
the word 'param' as well. eg

The pinciple is setting:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''  params op monitor interval="5s"''

When it should be:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''op monitor interval="5s"''

Including the word 'params' evenutally causes hacluster to fail with:
ERROR: syntax in primitive: params op monitor interval=5s

Change-Id: Id35bb22692914dc3f94465d8ae7d62971a238d4e
'}]
commit_message:
Principle sends invalid config to hacluster

When requesting hacluster manage an init service the principle
sends options to hacluster but is currently erroneously sending
the word 'param' as well. eg

The pinciple is setting:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''  params op monitor interval="5s"''

When it should be:
''res_designate_haproxy'': ''op monitor interval="5s"''

Including the word 'params' evenutally causes hacluster to fail with:
ERROR: syntax in primitive: params op monitor interval=5s

Change-Id: Id35bb22692914dc3f94465d8ae7d62971a238d4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-interface-hacluster refs/changes/06/347506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: crm.primitive(res_key, res_type, op='monitor interval="5s"')

added_lines: Nova has had a v2 API for a long time. We have currently moved to a new implementation of that API, which we have called v2.1. v2.1 started life as an API called v3, but that name should never be used any more. We have transitioned the users over to the v2.1 implementation. So, the v2 code is deprecated.* v2 (DEPRECATED) and v2 extensions (DEPRECATED)
deleted_lines: Nova has had a v2 API for a long time. We are currently in the process of moving to a new implementation of that API, which we have called v2.1. v2.1 started life as an API called v3, but that name should never be used any more. We are currently in the process of transitioning users over to the v2.1 implementation, at which point the v2 code will be deleted.* `v2 (SUPPORTED)`_ and `v2 extensions (SUPPORTED)`_ (Will be deprecated in the near future.).. _`v2 (SUPPORTED)`: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.html .. _`v2 extensions (SUPPORTED)`: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2-ext.html

subject: Expose quiesce/unquiesce API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 03:57:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6a1591a3f6d783fbdab46e5c82d03917642e828d', 'message': "[WIP]Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Atomic quiesce / unquiesce API will allow to make snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

"}, {'number': 53, 'created': '2016-01-05 08:57:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/de3f4d24e2c08a13b9978908b407fb433534bb7b', 'message': "Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Change-Id: I9ad01d0ef58b9f21ad2909b74fcdf00338df6f2c
Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api
"}, {'number': 70, 'created': '2016-01-20 06:15:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3c5d7b0c0744339f6c2e8aed4f887b4bac45520b', 'message': "Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Change-Id: I9ad01d0ef58b9f21ad2909b74fcdf00338df6f2c
Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

"}, {'number': 87, 'created': '2016-01-25 03:04:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bec43c3410139b8a1251fe0031d0f1508f50be27', 'message': "Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Change-Id: I9ad01d0ef58b9f21ad2909b74fcdf00338df6f2c
Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

commit_message:
Expose quiesce/unquiesce API

Currently the Nova provides single VM snapshot API (createImage), which
will take a consistency snapshot of a VM and regarding volumes, and will
quiesce unquiesce VM automatily with guest agent support.This method is good
for single VM consistency snapshot, but no way to make consistency
snapshot for an application which consists of multiple VMs.

Provide quiesce unquiesce API from Nova, to make consistency snapshot
of an application, which consists of a  group of VMs, for disaster
recovery purpose from another site.

Quiesce / unquiesce API will allo making snapshot of a group of
VMs in a transaction way, for example, quiesce VM1, quiesce VM2, quiesce VM3,
snapshot VM1's volumes, snapshot VM2's volumes, snapshot VM3's volumes,
unquiesce VM3, unquiesce VM2, unquiesce VM1. For some telecom application,
the order is important for a group of VMs with strong relationship.

This patch exposes the quiesce and unquiesce API

Co-Authored-By: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rui Chen <chenrui.momo@gmail.com>

APIImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API
DocImpact: Expose quiesce unquiesce API

Change-Id: I9ad01d0ef58b9f21ad2909b74fcdf00338df6f2c
Implements: blueprint expose-quiesce-unquiesce-api

added_lines: @wsgi.response(202) @extensions.expected_errors((404, 409)) @wsgi.action('quiesce') def _action_quiesce_instance(self, req, id, body): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context, action='quiesce') instance = self._get_server(context, req, id) LOG.debug('quiesce instance', instance=instance) try: self.compute_api.quiesce(context, instance) except exception.InstanceIsLocked as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPConflict(explanation=e.format_message()) except exception.InstanceInvalidState as state_error: common.raise_http_conflict_for_instance_invalid_state(state_error, 'quiesce', id) @wsgi.response(202) @extensions.expected_errors((404, 409)) @wsgi.action('unquiesce') def _action_quiesce_instance(self, req, id, body): context = req.environ['nova.context'] authorize(context, action='unquiesce') instance = self._get_server(context, req, id) LOG.debug('unquiesce instance', instance=instance) try: self.compute_api.unquiesce(context, instance) except exception.InstanceIsLocked as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPConflict(explanation=e.format_message()) except exception.InstanceInvalidState as state_error: common.raise_http_conflict_for_instance_invalid_state(state_error, 'unquiesce', id)

in conductor/test_conductor.py

subject: fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 04:57:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d99b2a6a78228410aeb31f464c90d08a810ab7d1', 'message': "fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient

When cinderclient got an admin context without token passed in,
The client don't really have the ability to communicate with cinder
service. This is because there is no auth_token and service_catalog
info in this admin context. Nova maintains some daemon threads
doing administrative jobs like reclaiming soft-deleted instances
which exactly have one such admin context. In such case, nova was
unable to detach the volumes attached soft-deleted instances.

Closes-Bug: 1560300
Related-Bug: 1408865
Related-Bug: 1346866

Change-Id: I775b65cc4664bf0c5700434747b622a182db8131
Signed-off-by: apporc <appleorchard2000@gmail.com>

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-21 02:40:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a6f861484e9252a9254236497fab0dcb291abe1a', 'message': "fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient

When cinderclient got an admin context without token passed in,
The client don't really have the ability to communicate with cinder
service. This is because there is no auth_token and service_catalog
info in this admin context. Nova maintains some daemon threads
doing administrative jobs like reclaiming soft-deleted instances
which exactly have one such admin context. In such case, nova was
unable to detach the volumes attached to soft-deleted instances.

DocImpact: add keystone auth options to cinder section. They are:
auth_type, auth_section, auth_url, domain_id, domain_name,
project_id, project_name, project_domain_id, project_domain_name,
trust_id, user_id, username, user_domain_id, user_domain_name,
password. If auth_section is set, all options except auth_type and
auth_section should be set in the section specified by auth_section.

Closes-Bug: 1560300
Related-Bug: 1408865

commit_message:
fix admin context scenarios for cinderclient

When cinderclient got an admin context without token passed in,
the client don't really have the ability to communicate with cinder
service. This is because there is no auth_token and service_catalog
info in this admin context. Nova maintains some daemon threads
doing administrative jobs like reclaiming soft-deleted instances
which exactly have one such admin context. In such case, nova was
unable to detach the volumes attached to soft-deleted instances.

This patch allow admin credentials to be specified in cinder section
of nova.conf. When case above happened, nova will load one real
admin auth plugin from cinder section and use it to communicate
with cinder. The admin user used here is better to be cinder with
admin roles.

The auth plugin once loaded is reusable.

DocImpact: add keystone auth options to cinder section. They are:
auth_type, auth_section, auth_url, domain_id, domain_name,
project_id, project_name, project_domain_id, project_domain_name,
trust_id, user_id, username, user_domain_id, user_domain_name,
password. If auth_section is set, all options except auth_type and
auth_section should be set in the section specified by auth_section.

Closes-Bug: 1560300
Related-Bug: 1408865
Related-Bug: 1346866

Change-Id: I775b65cc4664bf0c5700434747b622a182db8131
Signed-off-by: apporc <appleorchard2000@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Merge os-user-data extension into servers

The extension already deprecated in nova api, and the current extension
point didn't support Microversion, this isn't a way for extension point
to process differently with different Microversion. So this patch just
merge the os-user-data extension into servers directly to get rid of
the useless extension and extension point.

APIImpact
Partial implement blueprint userdata-modification

Change-Id: I5c761623cfe36b3eb64bcede21494fff27b6b926

commit_message:
[ZFSonLinux] Add 'manage share' feature support

Implement 'manage share' feature in ZFSonLinux share driver.

Prerequisites:
- share being managed should exist.
- share being managed should not be part of any replication relations.
- share being managed should not have redefined mountpoint.

Details:
- share being managed will be renamed by share driver based on taken ID.
- share being managed will get "quota" attribute set based on provided
  value in API (--driver_options size=5) or it will set quota
  to nearest bigger rounded integer of already
  used space (2,4 -> 3, 3.6 -> 4).

Implements blueprint zfsonlinux-manage-share
DocImpact

Change-Id: I03eab5e02835fe660dde0020601c02c0136bddeb

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix signature and behaviour of fake get_disk_backing_file

get_disk_backing_file in fake_libvirt_utils did not accept the
basename argument of the method it fakes, and obviously also did not
honour its function.

Change-Id: Ie137ff4f8c7887d4c94ed21e2e0e159d11c6983a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/337242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_disk_backing_file(path, basename=True, format=None): backing_file = disk_backing_files.get(path, None) if backing_file and basename: backing_file = os.path.basename(backing_file) return backing_file
deleted_lines: def get_disk_backing_file(path, format=None): return disk_backing_files.get(path, None)

commit_message:
libvirt: Pass path to Image base class

The base class uses path, so it should set it itself.

We also assume the existence of path in subsequent tests.

Change-Id: I8bf29cb05df731f11bdbfe82b7645e1e8ecc5e5a

commit_message:
Only ports on routed networks are deferred

A port has deferred IP allocation only if it is on a routed network.
Otherwise, it is just a port without any IP addresses.

The unit tests were testing for deferred IP allocation even in
situations where the network was not routed, so this patch fixes them
up.

Change-Id: Ieeab03c31b8f45d63b5044d85ded704d2fe027a9
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

subject: Filter out subnets on different segments for dhcp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 06:51:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7651993d7497634a1fec7a23e1d00e269c9a5ce6', 'message': "Creating dhcp port is segment aware

When a dhcp agent requests to create a port, it assumes all the
subnets under that port's network needs a fixed ip.  However, if
that port is created on a segment network, then there can be subnets
that reside on different segments.  IPAM is segment aware and will
not allow the allocation of an IP on subnets that reside in
different segments.

This patch filters the requested port fixed ips out by segment
based on the host.  So if a fixed ip is requested to be allocated in
a subnet,but the host does not reside on that subnet's segment, then
that fixed ip is removed from that request.

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-08 20:37:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cb5b8e0e18717c883fdf420bb05fd1e7863c0dbd', 'message': "Make create and update dhcp ports segment aware

not allow the allocation of an IP on subnets that reside in
different segments.

This patch filters the requested port fixed ips out by segment
based on the host.  So if a fixed ip is requested to be allocated in
a subnet,but the host does not reside on that subnet's segment, then

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e

When a dhcp agent requests to create or update a port, it assumes all
the subnets under that port's network needs a fixed ip.  However, if
that port is on a segmented network, then there can be subnets

This patch filters the requested port fixed ips out by segment
based on the host.  So if a fixed ip is requested to be allocated in

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-13 22:23:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8f1bfb1930db085ed93214c8180009dc989549dd', 'message': "Filter out subnets on different segments for dhcp

The dhcp agent will request network information from neutron-server.
neutron-server will give the dhcp agent the entire network tree back
to the agent including subnets.  If that agent is on a host that
is mapped to a segment, subnets that are do not belong to that
segment are also returned and the dhcp agent will attempt to create
or update the dhcp port based on those subnets.  These requests
will fail because the ipam logic forbids it for multiple segments.

This patch strips out those subnets that do not belong to the host's
segment.  If the segments plugin is not enabled or the network is not
segmented then the neutron-server will return back to the agent what
it normally would without segments.

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e

commit_message:
Filter out subnets on different segments for dhcp

The dhcp agent will request network information from neutron-server.
neutron-server will give the dhcp agent the entire network tree back
to the agent including subnets.  If that agent is on a host that
is mapped to a segment, subnets that do not belong to that
segment are also returned and the dhcp agent will attempt to create
or update the dhcp port based on those subnets.  These requests
will fail because the ipam logic forbids it for multiple segments.

This patch strips out those subnets that do not belong to the host's
segment.  If the segments plugin is not enabled or the network is not
a routed network then the neutron-server will return back to the agent
what it normally would without routed networks.

Change-Id: I379b56f510853c60bb52c2d710117fecfb9aca2e
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Docs for osa-differ.py

This patch adds documentation for using the ``osa-differ.py`` script
and how to handle GitHub API tokens.

Change-Id: I746d1fd75d81d964c76aca3cde6bfe1a667c3645
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/98/344398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================================== OpenStack-Ansible Diff Generator Documentation ============================================== Getting a list of commits between two OpenStack-Ansible tags is fairly easy with ``git diff``, but it can be difficult to review other changes between those tags, such as: * Changes to OpenStack projects that OpenStack-Ansible downloads and compiles into python wheels on the repo servers * Changes to independent OpenStack-Ansible roles (Mitaka and later releases) The ``osa-differ.py`` script retrieves all of these changes and displays them in an easy-to-read RST-formatted document. The script queries GitHub's API and downloads some raw code to determine the changes in each repository. This allows the script to work well on systems where the OpenStack-Ansible repositories aren't already cloned. Installation ============ Install two packages via pip: .. code-block:: console pip install jinja2 pygithub3 Running the script ================== Generating diffs ---------------- The script has two required arguments: .. code-block:: shell ./osa-differ.py OLD_COMMIT NEW_COMMIT Tags or commit SHAs can be used for ``OLD_COMMIT`` and ``NEW_COMMIT``. Here are two examples: .. code-block:: shell # Find changes between commits f7d0a73 (older) and e00d329 (newer) ./osa-differ.py f7d0a73 e00d329 # Find changes between tags 13.1.4 and 13.2.0 ./osa-differ.py 13.1.4 13.2.0 If you reach the GitHub API limit for unauthenticated users, you may see a 403 error like this one:: requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: <URL> You can provide a GitHub API token by setting the ``GITHUB_TOKEN`` environment variable and running the script again: .. code-block:: shell export GITHUB_TOKEN=fe64e5bff33523tat32913f69c49fe93d664e3a0 ./osa-differ.py 13.1.4 13.2.0 For more details on generating GitHub API tokens, see the documentation section :ref:`generate-github-token` below. Configuring the output ---------------------- By default, the report will contain changes to OpenStack-Ansible, OpenStack- Ansible's independent roles, and the OpenStack projects that OpenStack-Ansible downloads and builds. However, the information about independent roles and OpenStack-Ansible roles can be skipped with additional arguments: .. code-block:: shell # Show only the changes in OpenStack projects ./osa-differ.py --projects-only 13.1.4 13.2.0 # Show only the changes in OpenStack-Ansible independent roles ./osa-differ.py --roles-only 13.1.4 13.2.0 Troubleshooting --------------- Enable the script's debug mode by adding ``-d`` or ``--debug`` to the command line arguments: .. code-block:: shell ./osa-differ.py --debug 13.1.4 13.2.0 This will print lots of diagnostic information about each request to GitHub and will identify any requests which are taking a long time to complete. Appendix ======== .. _generate-github-token: Generating GitHub API tokens ---------------------------- To generate a GitHub *personal access token*, follow these steps: #. Authenticate to your GitHub account. #. Access the *Personal access tokens* page: https://github.com/settings/tokens #. Click on **Generate new token**. (You may be asked to provide your password.) #. Enter a name for the token and click **Generate token**. (Leave all check boxes unchecked.) #. Copy your new token and store it in safe place. GitHub won't display it again, so be sure to save it or you will need to generate another token. #. Provide that token in the ``GITHUB_TOKEN`` environment variable before running the ``osa-differ.py`` script.

commit_message:
Define keystone region name.

If multiple regions exist, keystone_authtoken should contain region_name.
This prevents the service from authenticating across regions.

Change-Id: I35771c73954fb8962bbcc7ae8963900b68ea5e5c

commit_message:
Cleanup image file options in scenario tests

This commit cleans up the image file options and workflow for
specifying image files in the scenario tests. Instead of having
multiple options and a fallback to amazon style 3 part images this
commit switches to having a single option to specify the location of
an image file to upload and will raise an exception if it's not found.

Change-Id: Ib1ddfadb30fb8c8f663e3febcae706fe30b1f573
Closes-Bug: #1393881

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/aca7e5a6989491c02e198b09c1a599ecca63cd5f', 'message': "Only update port ACLs if necessary

When an instance is launched, there will be 3 port updates for

transactions (assuming the use of the default security group).

commit_message:
Only update port ACLs if necessary

Port ACLs are always being deleted and added on a port update
even if the update doesn't impact ACLs (e.g. update port name).
This patch set will only update port ACLs when the port's
fixed IPs or security groups have changed. In addition, the
update will compare the old and new ACLs to compress the OVN
transaction down to the ACL changes.

When an instance is launched, there will be 3 port updates for
host binding, vif binding and status update. These updates do
not change the port ACLs, yet resulted in 51 unnecessary ACL
transactions (assuming the use of the default security group).

Basic performance testing with this change improved port update
without ACL changes by approximately 12%.

Change-Id: I91bed00fb3f7c42efbc2d5156095b13d9348b6f5
Closes-Bug: #1605274

commit_message:
Handle new-format facets response

As part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/count-endpoint the
API facets endpoint is changing. This patch adds support for both
formats during the transition period by converting old-format responses
to the new one ({resource_type: []} -> {resource_type: {facets: []}}

Change-Id: Ibe22a97bda0d7990ab19ef65fd5d63d84e1465f5
Partially-implements: blueprint count-endpoint
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight-ui refs/changes/34/333034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six Note - the response is changing for the searchlight 1.0 release. In Mitaka the value for each resource type was a list (the content of the 'facets' key in the new format). "OS::Glance::Image": { "facets": [ { "name": "status", "type": "string" }, { "name": "created_at", "type": "date" } ... ], "doc_count": 2 }, "OS::Nova::Server": { "facets": [ { "name": "status", "options": [ { "doc_count": 1, "key": "ACTIVE" } ], "type": "string" } ... ], "doc_count": 1 } facet_res = searchlight_get('/search/facets', request, params=request.GET).json() if not facet_res: return facet_res # Check for old-format responses first_value = six.itervalues(facet_res).next() if isinstance(first_value, list): # Old-style return {rt: {'facets': val} for rt, val in six.iteritems(facet_res)} return facet_res

commit_message:
Switch to keystoneauth

move cinderclient to keystoneauth as keystoneclient's auth session,
plugins and adapter code has been deprecated.

Co-Authored-By: Paulo Ewerton <pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jamie Lennox <jamielennox@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id4bf0e2088e8ad99e83cd4f9b8549c2aca1f65a2

commit_message:
Support new facet response format

The facet response format is changing as part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/count-endpoint such
that the value for each resource type becomes a dictionary (instead of a
list) with keys 'facets' and 'doc_count'. This patch allows
python-searchlightclient to parse either response in preparation for the
change.

Change-Id: Iddd3ad4bfe277c513a304ff03eccffa8ba928973
Partially-implements: blueprint count-endpoint

commit_message:
Added quotes to example echo in swift-temp-url

If the curl command is used exactly as in the help, the ampersand
in the signature is interpreted as an operator and the curl
command breaks. I am aware of developers who have wasted a lot of
time because of this.

Change-Id: I6468c9a098b56db8242a2cf2c23b7a4857bd8574

of port schema as we already have current_dns_name in

to hide the detail of dns information from the prespective of
core plugin.

'}, {'number': 32, 'created': '2016-06-24 02:48:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0df06a08190b02e43a6d0facbe529a12341ad743', 'message': 'Refactor DNS integration out of DB core plugin

This patch set aims to move all the code related to DNS integration
from the DB core plugin to the DNS ML2 extension module.

By doing this, this patchset removes the dns related code in
db_base_plugin_v2 and the dns exteions module talks with core plugin
only through the method extension_manager and apply_dict_extend_functions

By properly implementing the generation of the dns_assignment attribute
for ports in the DNS ML2 extension module, this patchset also fixes
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1579977

Change-Id: I63afb1a1bfeeb14eefb54681dc64959144deeb25
Closes-Bug: #1579601
Closes-Bug: #1579977
'}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2016-07-25 17:46:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0f782faf6caf532c95de75e19b20d59992b4fbc1', 'message': 'Refactor DNS integration out of DB core plugin

This patch set aims to move all the code related to DNS integration
from the DB core plugin to the DNS ML2 extension module.

By doing this, this patchset removes the dns related code in
db_base_plugin_v2 and the dns exteions module talks with core plugin
only through the method extension_manager and apply_dict_extend_functions

By properly implementing the generation of the dns_assignment attribute
for ports in the DNS ML2 extension module, this patchset also fixes
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1579977

Change-Id: I63afb1a1bfeeb14eefb54681dc64959144deeb25

Closes-Bug: #1579977

commit_message:
Refactor DNS integration out of DB core plugin

This patch set aims to move all the code related to DNS integration
from the DB core plugin to the DNS ML2 extension module.

By doing this, this patchset removes the dns related code in
db_base_plugin_v2 and the dns exteions module talks with core plugin
only through the method extension_manager and apply_dict_extend_functions

By properly implementing the generation of the dns_assignment attribute
for ports in the DNS ML2 extension module, this patchset also fixes
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1579977

Change-Id: I63afb1a1bfeeb14eefb54681dc64959144deeb25
Closes-Bug: #1579601
Closes-Bug: #1579977
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/91/313291/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: current_dns_name = request_data[dns.DNSNAME] current_dns_domain = network[dns.DNSDOMAIN] current_dns_name=current_dns_name, current_dns_domain=current_dns_domain, fqdn = '%s.%s' % (current_dns_name, current_dns_domain) db_data['dns_name'] = current_dns_name ips = db_data['fixed_ips'] db_data['dns_assignment'] = [] for ip in ips: db_data['dns_assignment'].append({'ip_address': ip['ip_address'], 'hostname': current_dns_name, 'fqdn': fqdn}) try: dnsdb = getattr(db_data, "dns") if dns is not None: response_data[dns.DNSNAME] = dnsdb['current_dns_name'] else: response_data[dns.DNSNAME] = '' except Exception, e: response_data[dns.DNSNAME] = ''

commit_message:
Add CI scripts

Add CI scripts for:
- lint
- syntax 3 and 4
- unit
- beaker

And remove run_tests.sh which is not useful anymore.

Change-Id: I235d8561d6cc2c593cf788ced04d1394127ab3ce

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This networking-midonet change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

Change-Id: Ia59629fd953750c9f7d495e74c7ca6cfbf3ca077

commit_message:
Copy Fuel's keys in upgrade-env command

  Those keys are generated on the first "deploy_changes" for
  an environtment.

  It's ok to regenerate them in the majority cases,
  but, for example, in case of TLS + self-signed certificate
  it would be a problem. MongoDB replication also depends on
  those keys.

Change-Id: I6e5e65feff2b662336028ca5114f7245147d664f
Closes-Bug: 1595499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/57/334357/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import shutil def copy_fuel_keys(source_env_id, seed_env_id): source_env_keys_path = os.path.join( magic_consts.FUEL_KEYS_BASE_PATH, str(source_env_id) ) seed_env_keys_path = os.path.join( magic_consts.FUEL_KEYS_BASE_PATH, str(seed_env_id) ) shutil.copytree(source_env_keys_path, seed_env_keys_path)

commit_message:
Add share manage/unmanage of Oracle ZFSSA driver

- Manage share: ask Manila to take control of an existing ZFSSA share
not managed by Manila driver. Current share size will be rounded up
to the nearest whole GB value.
- Unmanage share: ask Manila to release control of a ZFSSA share
managed by the driver.

Change-Id: I0d4a46211dfd15cb7a261eddfa8c14be26adcfc3
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-share-manage

commit_message:
Add trove tempest plugin

This commit takes the trove tests which previously lived in tempest
and creates an in-tree tempest plugin out of them. The contents of
the plugin are taken with tempest checkout out at commit:
eda607cb1c89762a54290c4525d81c1b192c421f with modifications made for
things to live in the trove repo.

Change-Id: Ibad5502cdca0e34cca4b5bc8a7106611f7393cf2

commit_message:
Prepare context tests for new to_dict() attributes

The pending release of oslo.context (2.6.0) introduces a new attribute
to the to_dict() method that will break tests that do a exact dictionary
comparison.  This patch creates a smarter forward compatible approach
to enable existing tests to function as designed and support new
attributes without failure.

Change-Id: I4829ad11d84bf7bd5ea3b87a46c799aa16d183cf
Closes-Bug: 1603979

commit_message:
Replace OpenStack LLC w/ OpenStack Foundation

Some files use trademark OpenStack LLC in header, which
should be changed to OpenStack Foundation according to
openstack trademark policy.
http://www.openstack.org/brand/openstack-trademark-policy/

Change-Id: I3b4665c023acc6d53dcf17417b4ce625ed3d096b
Related-Bug: #1214176

commit_message:
Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the
functional jobs could be 'func' or any other name, a negative match
is used on the docs job name instead.

Change-Id: I71d247d0253bd8f42ae2984a9a5c1b91ceb01a79

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are renamed to
``project_id``.
neutron-lbaas change accompanies neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

commit_message:
Python 3: dict.iteritems()

Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items(). The Python 3 dict
type has no iteritems() method, the old iteritems() method was
renamed to items().

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I2137e72554fd16d2c70e50306e4f57d27e35bcd3

commit_message:
Configure memcached using new settings in [cache] section

Some components like the vnc console make use of a shared cache to share
auth tokens between the controllers.  This makes a shared cache a kind of
requirement for these features to correctly work.  The configuration of
memcached servers has changed from the deprecated memcached_servers setting
in [DEFAULT] to several settings in the [cache] section.  This patch sets
these settings in order to make sure a shared cache is used.

Change-Id: I8add7bc7870ede7bbdd0df6a5bc5199e32a5ab33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/97/346097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class { '::nova::cache' : enabled => true, backend => 'oslo_cache.memcache_pool', memcache_servers => $memcached_servers }

subject: Fix races in advertise_address unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 14:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/7ab53e34b09435c3ef3ea3c87f9a7708d90ad9db', 'message': "Fix races in advertise_address unit tests

This was testing that _check_for_iscsi was called, which is part of
evaluate_hardware_support for the in-tree hardware manager.
evaluate_hardware_support is called at hardware manager instantiation,
which can happen when dispatch_to_managers is called. The hardware
manager instances are cached, so calling dispatch_to_managers won't
always invoke _check_for_iscsi. As such, these tests were intermittently
failing.

Mock _check_for_iscsi at the class level for these tests (since it's
unrelated), and don't check that it was called.

Change-Id: Iefca50c4c231c5eafd199bf8da6649bc3008a8fa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix races in advertise_address unit tests

This was testing that _check_for_iscsi was called, which is part of
evaluate_hardware_support for the in-tree hardware manager.
evaluate_hardware_support is called at hardware manager instantiation,
which can happen when dispatch_to_managers is called. The hardware
manager instances are cached, so calling dispatch_to_managers won't
always invoke _check_for_iscsi. As such, these tests were intermittently
failing.

Mock _check_for_iscsi at the class level for these tests (since it's
unrelated), and don't check that it was called.

Change-Id: Iefca50c4c231c5eafd199bf8da6649bc3008a8fa

commit_message:
Remove Cinder leftovers from Create Snapshot View

Share state cannot be "in-use", so the whole if statement
is unused. This patch removes it and makes a corresponding
cleanup in html template and unit test.

Change-Id: I5030ed7751e561db7d1b7ab1255d6fa8daf387f9

commit_message:
Remove "host" from driver private data

The "host" field in driver private data related db and api is not
used and no longer needed. This patches removes it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint driver-private-storage

commit_message:
Remove sahara and cinder packaged symlinks in postci

If a job fails before the overcloud deployment starts, the ansible task
run by infra to collect logs will fail because of dangling symlinks on
the subnodes in the /etc/cinder and /etc/sahara directories.

This change just remove the symlinks on each subnodo so that the rsync
command to collect the logs won't fail.

Change-Id: If0a151abdeaa1e607d672175f8bcb170027b9ac6
Closes-Bug: #1606368

commit_message:
Make sure --bypass-url honored if specified

Currently SessionClient ignored --bypass-url which is only used with
HTTPClient. This change force to use HTTPClient if bypass-url specified.

Change-Id: I03d1eec8cfda81efce409399b8d6ca91b779840b
Closes-Bug: #1467577

When using the wait functionality, one must use the last index increased

commit_message:
etcd: properly block when using 'wait'

When using the wait functionality, one must use the last index increased
by one, as the wait returns once that index has been used. Using the
index that is already been returned by the etcd instance will cause
'wait' to return immediately, producing a busy-wait loop while spamming
the server with the same requests over and over.

Closes-Bug: #1603002
Change-Id: I4f3bee0a52dcf2eb69b96b53a9f777a5e2a7efb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/93/342093/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "?wait=true&waitIndex=%d" % (reply['index'] + 1),
