commit_message:
Add check to limit maximum value of age_in_days

If you pass age_in_days value greater than unix epoch
then it raises OverflowError. Added check to ensure
age_in_days is within unix epoch time to fix this problem.

Removed the redundant check for age_in_days value from
cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api module which is already checked
at cinder.cmd.manage module.

Closes-Bug: #1543937
Change-Id: Ib418627fb8527a1275c2656d1451f1e1dfeb72ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/57/322757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time def _test_purge_invalid_age_in_days(self, age_in_days): db_cmds = cinder_manage.DbCommands() ex = self.assertRaises(SystemExit, db_cmds.purge, age_in_days) self.assertEqual(1, ex.code) def test_purge_age_in_days_value_equal_to_zero(self): age_in_days = 0 self._test_purge_invalid_age_in_days(age_in_days) def test_purge_with_negative_age_in_days(self): age_in_days = -1 self._test_purge_invalid_age_in_days(age_in_days) def test_purge_exceeded_age_in_days_limit(self): age_in_days = int(time.time() / 86400) + 1 self._test_purge_invalid_age_in_days(age_in_days) @mock.patch('cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api.purge_deleted_rows') @mock.patch('cinder.context.get_admin_context') def test_purge_less_than_age_in_days_limit(self, get_admin_context, purge_deleted_rows): age_in_days = int(time.time() / 86400) - 1 ctxt = context.RequestContext(fake.USER_ID, fake.PROJECT_ID, is_admin=True) get_admin_context.return_value = ctxt purge_deleted_rows.return_value = None db_cmds = cinder_manage.DbCommands() db_cmds.purge(age_in_days) get_admin_context.assert_called_once_with() purge_deleted_rows.assert_called_once_with( ctxt, age_in_days=age_in_days)

typical response.

commit_message:
Add TripleO gate jobs to the same job

TripleO CI status page is showing these 2 gates in different jobs.

gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha
gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-nv

So, when showing the results they are not linked together in
the same job.

Change-Id: I40b0dd2d09d9fb73525b538a68bd8629dac3948a

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I336dae4702abb0a671b940bdc50afeb21a118d6f

commit_message:
Disable V-38660 in gate

The Xenial image in the CI gate has non-SNMPv3 configurations
and it causes the security role to halt the playbook. This patch
skips the task until we can figure out a better fix.

Change-Id: I7b18b392c9e24e638c5e70e594f065f50a19b6b9

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I62c4e2a01cf6f5e6c03f67022ea946b420700f85

commit_message:
api-ref: Refresh images schemas

The schemas in the current api-ref are outdated.  This patch adds
the schemas contained in the 13.0.0.0b2 release.

Change-Id: I45615e049339b3df8d1c6cda74d7408a177aba4e
Closes-bug: #1606250

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:10:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a263665d02be78344786ab2b5bcd0f125666f7fa', 'message': 'Add a service client data store

Define a class that holds data for service clients and service
client groups. It will include data from three type of sources:
- internal client groups (six core services)
- client groups defined in tempet plugins
- client groups temporarily defined in tempest tree, to be moved
  to a plug-in eventually

The class definition is decorated with singleton, so that the
client and client group data is only loaded once at plugin
registration time.

Include unit test coverage for the new class.

Change-Id: If2295d56a8e52ffce28d6a0f15517bc325aab010
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

commit_message:
Introduce the ClientsFactory

Define a new class ClientsFactory, which provides lazy loading
an simple instantiation of clients by using partial to set
defaults for all client parameters.

This class will be used in upcoming patches to implement an
interface that allows plugins to register their own service
clients in the ServiceClients interface.

It will also be used to implement lazy loading of clients for
tempest own clients.

Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

Change-Id: If2295d56a8e52ffce28d6a0f15517bc325aab010

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import mock from tempest_lib import auth from tempest import clients from tempest import exceptions from tempest.tests import base from tempest.tests.services.fake_client import FakeServiceClient from tempest.tests.services.fake_client import FakeServiceClient2 class FakeCredentials(auth.Credentials): def is_valid(self): return True class TestServiceClientsData(base.TestCase): group_name1 = 'fake_group' group_name2 = 'fake_group2' group_description = 'fake_group_description' def _register(self, service_clients, group_params, group_name=None, **client_params): group_name = group_name or self.group_name1 self.data.register_clients_group( group_name, service_clients, self.group_description, group_params, **client_params) def setUp(self): super(TestServiceClientsData, self).setUp() self.data = clients.ServiceClientsData() def tearDown(self): super(TestServiceClientsData, self).tearDown() # This is a singleton, so we need to cleanup after each test self.data._client_groups = {} self.data._client_specs = {} def test_get_client_name(self): name = self.data._get_client_name(FakeServiceClient) self.assertEqual('fake_service', name) def test_register_clients_group_empty(self): # No special reason to forbid an empty group # Test the various group params group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_params = {'FakeServiceClients': ['p3', 'p4']} service_clients = [] self._register(service_clients, group_params, **client_params) # If not group is not found raises an exception, so implicit assert group = self.data.get_group(name=self.group_name1) groups = self.data.get_groups() clients = self.data.get_clients(group=self.group_name1) # Assert group is registered msg = 'Registered group %s not found in list' self.assertIn(self.group_name1, [x.name for x in groups], msg % self.group_name1) # Assert group params are correct msg = 'Group params %s do not match with expected %s' self.assertEqual(group_params, group.params, msg % (group.params, group_params)) # Assert description is correct msg = 'Group desciption %s does not match with expected %s' self.assertEqual(self.group_description, group.description, msg % (group.description, self.group_description)) # Assert clients are empty msg = 'Client list is %s instead of an empty list' self.assertEqual([], clients, msg % [x for x.name in clients]) def test_register_clients_group_one_client(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_klass = FakeServiceClient fake_client_params = ['p3', 'p4'] client_params = {client_klass.__name__: fake_client_params} service_clients = [client_klass] self._register(service_clients, group_params, **client_params) group = self.data.get_group(name=self.group_name1) _clients = self.data.get_clients(group=self.group_name1) # Assert client found in list msg = 'Registered client %s not found in list' self.assertIn(client_klass, [x.klass for x in _clients], msg % client_klass.__name__) # Assert properties of client client = self.data.get_client(client_klass) msg = 'Property %s of client does not match' self.assertEqual(self.group_name1, client.group.name, msg % 'group name') self.assertEqual(group, client.group, msg % 'group') self.assertEqual(client_klass, client.klass, msg % 'client class') self.assertEqual(fake_client_params, client.params, msg % 'client params') def test_register_clients_group_duplicate_group(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_params = {'FakeServiceClients': ['p3', 'p4']} service_clients = [] self._register(service_clients, group_params, **client_params) dcn = self.assertRaises(exceptions.DuplicateClientName, self._register, service_clients, group_params, **client_params) # Verifies the exception self.assertRegexpMatches(str(dcn), '^.* %s .*$' % self.group_name1) def test_register_clients_group_duplicate_client_one_group(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_klass = FakeServiceClient client_params = {FakeServiceClient.__name__: ['p3', 'p4']} service_clients = [client_klass, client_klass] dcr = self.assertRaises(exceptions.DuplicateClientName, self._register, service_clients, group_params, **client_params) self.assertRegexpMatches(str(dcr), '^.* %s .*$' % client_klass.__name__) def test_register_clients_group_duplicate_client_two_groups(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_klass = FakeServiceClient client_params = {FakeServiceClient.__name__: ['p3', 'p4']} service_clients = [client_klass] self._register(service_clients, group_params, **client_params) dcr = self.assertRaises(exceptions.DuplicateClientName, self._register, service_clients, group_params, group_name=self.group_name2, **client_params) self.assertRegexpMatches(str(dcr), '^.* %s .*$' % client_klass.__name__) def test_register_clients_group_two_groups(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_klass1 = FakeServiceClient client_klass2 = FakeServiceClient2 self._register([client_klass1], group_params) self._register([client_klass2], group_params, group_name=self.group_name2) groups = self.data.get_groups() self.assertEqual(2, len(groups), 'Only %s groups found' % len(groups)) _clients = self.data.get_clients() self.assertEqual(2, len(_clients), 'Only %s clients found' % len(_clients)) client1 = self.data.get_clients(self.group_name1) self.assertEqual(1, len(client1), '%s clients returned, not 1' % len(client1)) self.assertEqual(self.group_name1, client1[0].group.name, 'Client group %s does not match' % client1[0].group.name) client2 = self.data.get_clients(self.group_name2) self.assertEqual(1, len(client2), '%s clients returned, not 1' % len(client2)) self.assertEqual(self.group_name2, client2[0].group.name, 'Client group %s does not match' % client2[0].group.name) def test_register_clients_group_two_clients_one_groups(self): group_params = ('p1', 'p2') client_klass1 = FakeServiceClient client_klass2 = FakeServiceClient2 single_client_params1 = ['p3', 'p4'] single_client_params2 = ['p5', 'p6'] client_params = { client_klass1.__name__: single_client_params1, client_klass2.__name__: single_client_params2} self._register([client_klass1, client_klass2], group_params, **client_params) _clients = self.data.get_clients() self.assertEqual(2, len(_clients), 'Only %s clients found' % len(_clients)) _clients_filter = self.data.get_clients(self.group_name1) self.assertEqual(2, len(_clients_filter), 'Only %s clients found' % len(_clients)) for client in _clients_filter: self.assertEqual(self.group_name1, client.group.name, 'Client group %s does not match' % client.group.name) msg = 'Parameters registered %s do not match with discovered %s' client1 = self.data.get_client(client_klass1) self.assertEqual(set(single_client_params1), set(client1.params), msg % (set(client1.params), set(single_client_params1))) client2 = self.data.get_client(client_klass2) self.assertEqual(set(single_client_params2), set(client2.params), msg % (set(client2.params), set(single_client_params2)))

commit_message:
Remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging

oslo.messaging has deprecated usage of transport aliases.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180434/
we should remove aliases of rpc backend for messaging.

Change-Id: If3b604bebdce774dc2580da6577efd726e09dce5
Closes-Bug: #1606125

subject: Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 13:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/93c34c3d56153d0d5195be22384a57fcb025bc19', 'message': "Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I226bbaae1ea047bacbcd7579314bb1de11709ef3
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I226bbaae1ea047bacbcd7579314bb1de11709ef3

commit_message:
different-format-for-ipv4-and-ipv6

This change will allow users to define seperate
formats for ipv4 and ipv6 addresses.
this requires formatv4 and formatv6 to de defined in
designate.conf instead of format.

format has been marked depricated

Change-Id: Ief685ba6a00da5100013f4ab71768c661f37ee13
Implements: blueprint different-format-for-ipv4-and-ipv6

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: Ifb66e109667ae14f56f83a91301b0595319a24ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/57/346757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {[testenv:docs]commands}

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: I2794185c0fce4c5fb027cb63d20850c72c4a91a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-memcached_server refs/changes/50/346750/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-16 20:35:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/697a232822047f925fd1989e8e6869e3f782ff2d', 'message': "Update all SHAs for 13.3.0

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/mitaka.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies..

Change-Id: I2d792947b2502eadff9adc08c5b21dca33f37856
Depends-On: I9972158427cf06844a1af68f43479428def0f3b7
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-20 05:41:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/2c5e21c35407e6cd62bff87c44d762bd6563fe35', 'message': "Update all SHAs for 13.3.0

  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies..

Change-Id: I2d792947b2502eadff9adc08c5b21dca33f37856
Depends-On: I9972158427cf06844a1af68f43479428def0f3b7
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9
Depends-On: I53864a34f3ba56a84ed658fa3952aba3c509e0b1
"}]
commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.0

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/mitaka.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies..

Change-Id: I2d792947b2502eadff9adc08c5b21dca33f37856
Depends-On: I9972158427cf06844a1af68f43479428def0f3b7
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9
Depends-On: I53864a34f3ba56a84ed658fa3952aba3c509e0b1

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: Ib42f126e4423a39e9431aa1ee7ab57dc7e9d2ead

commit_message:
Ensure that doc linting is included in the linters test

The 'docs' tox target executes the doc8 lint test which may result in
failures when testing documentation builds, but OpenStack-CI does not
execute that tox target.

In order to ensure that we catch all standard documentation syntax
errors and prevent them from merging, this patch includes the docs
target in the 'linters' chain of tests.

Fixes for any failures which result from executing this test are also
included in the patch.

Change-Id: Ib5efcbffee7b621c15aa252c05e0714dadc78962
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/58/346758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix typo in baymodel param

A param for the coe in baymodel currently reads 'mondatory',
it should be 'mandatory'.

Closes-Bug: #1605705
Change-Id: I519a7c4cc56d5c53ecaccaed07dfad774b4c4900

commit_message:
Fix improperly rendered Create Snapshot modal form

Create Share Snapshot form validation works for only one time.
On the second try whatever values are used, a correct ones or not,
the form closes with "There was an error submitting the form.
Please try again." message. It appears that form_invalid method
returns broken submit url. This patch moves rendering to get_initial
method to get a proper submit url for valid and invalid forms.

Change-Id: Ic41a49570e947026ec1a03a7a6fc99a7fb320f1c
Closes-Bug: #1585244
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui refs/changes/21/342221/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if share.status == 'in-use': self.submit_url = reverse(self.submit_url, kwargs=self.kwargs)

subject: WIP: Update group information in live-migration conditional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 17:29:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/scheduler/utils.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/327cea935b02f855a38a934da33437a62d9d4e95', 'message': 'WIP: Update group information in live-migration conditional

So, we had a bug on live-migration calls where we were verifying the
RequestSpec object for getting the original request but we trusted
the InstanceGroup persisted information that could be out-of-date.
A follow-up of that change will consist in considering the group information
for the RequestSpec to be lazy-loadable so we always get fresh content, but
given the bug is pretty important, we first need to have an easy way to fix the
problem without requiring a huge change in the object that would prevent a
backport.

TODO: Missing UTs

Change-Id: I500383d8c9af90c0984d4f8b555e93a510d1c97e
Closes-Bug: #1400016
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Update group information in live-migration conditional

So, we had a bug on live-migration calls where we were verifying the
RequestSpec object for getting the original request but we trusted
the InstanceGroup persisted information that could be out-of-date.
A follow-up of that change will consist in considering the group information
for the RequestSpec to be lazy-loadable so we always get fresh content, but
given the bug is pretty important, we first need to have an easy way to fix the
problem without requiring a huge change in the object that would prevent a
backport.

TODO: Missing UTs

Change-Id: I500383d8c9af90c0984d4f8b555e93a510d1c97e
Closes-Bug: #1400016

commit_message:
Allow for Ceph per-pool parameters

With this change pg_num, pgp_num and size can be redefined for each
pool instead of being enforced to the same set of values for all pools.

Change-Id: I0a001d2ce5666f43f4b5d56b3cd32cf17a1edae6
Closes-Bug: 1517969

commit_message:
Remove unused code when failing to start console

Processutils.ProcessExecutionError is never raised when it is unable
to stop an old shellinabox process due to a fix[1][2]. Instead of the
error, ConsoleError is raised. It would be better not to ignore the
error and to fail to start a console for avoiding process leak.

This patch removes a block for the exception which is never raised.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242319/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244699/

Change-Id: Ia1226da652510c5655c9b8c270e6fc168efd935d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/24/346524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from oslo_concurrency import processutils :raises: ConsoleError if the directory for the PID file cannot be created. except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: LOG.warning(_LW("Failed to kill the old console process " "before starting a new shellinabox console " "for node %(node)s. Reason: %(err)s"), {'node': node_uuid, 'err': exc})

commit_message:
devstack: configurable ODL repositories paths

Make the OpenDaylight snapshot & release repositories paths a
configuration so those can be overridden in case you prefer using
a proxy repository for them (for fetching artfiacts more
efficiently), and the proxy has a different path for them.

Change-Id: I9d8cfa92d15fe2e975b40312193f23ad02af8cd7

commit_message:
Bump default undercloud vCPUs to 8

Three out of the four chassis' in CentOS CI have slower CPUs, but
they have more of cores. I have tested bumping the number of CPUs
on the undercloud on these slower chassis' and it made a big
difference. More so, the memory pressure on the undercloud is
actually not bad now, so there is not too much risk in hitting
issues where more CPUs causes high memory consumption.

This also increases the default in the HA configuration by the same
factor (2x).

Change-Id: I44f34827774353f9f70e7fd51c524567914059ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/71/347371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add base constraint so gnocchi metricd is tied to core-clone

Currently if we manually restart the cluster saometimes gnocchi statsd
doesnt comeup as galera is not up yet. This should tie the metrics to
core and follow the order.

Closes-bug: #1604860

Change-Id: I37117c1d8fda621c4ccb975b5074d5e5044c3b0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/23/344823/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pacemaker::constraint::base { 'keystone-then-gnocchi-metricd-constraint': constraint_type => 'order', first_resource => 'openstack-core-clone', second_resource => "${::gnocchi::params::metricd_service_name}-clone", first_action => 'start', second_action => 'start', require => [Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::gnocchi::params::metricd_service_name], Pacemaker::Resource::Ocf['openstack-core']], }

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 14:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'releasenotes/notes/run-playbooks-refactor-c89400feb692cd91.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/e93e5ba963b843339c6881a8303ff8979a6d5481', 'message': 'Refactor run-playbooks

This changes the run playbooks script so that its using our core CLI
tools and is no longer a special case script running bits outside of
simply running the deployment tools as they've been designed.

The script is still executing all of the playbooks using the
"scripts-library" function ``install_bits`` so that we ensure gate

A notice has been added to the script whenever it exits notifying

commit_message:
Refactor run-playbooks

This changes the run playbooks script so that its using our core CLI
tools and is no longer a special case script running bits outside of
simply running the deployment tools as they've been designed.

The script is still executing all of the playbooks using the
"scripts-library" function ``install_bits`` so that we ensure gate
success by having a retry on a playbook execution in the case of transient
failure.

A notice has been added to the script whenever it exits notifying
the deployer that they should now work out of the playbooks directory
and never execute the run-playbooks.sh script ever again. Within the
notice links to our documentation have been added.

The ironic services were removed from the integrated gate because they're
not ready for general consumption and not being tested at this time because
no test configuration has been added into the tempest role or the
``run-tempest.sh`` script.

Change-Id: I064c1c480d261a885666b7dc3edc4cd0769876a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9be0662c4f79783d4db8736b89bbd38063635067)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/33/346833/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - The ``run-playbooks.sh`` script has been refactored to run all playbooks using our core tool set and run order. The refactor work updates the old special case script to a tool that simply runs the integrated playbooks as they've been designed.

Use zpne_start and zone_end in NXActionCT

Due to a change in ryu API, zone_ofs_bits is replaced with zone_start
and zone_end. This change reflects that, and uses the new parameters in
stead of the old one

Closes-Bug: 1599367

commit_message:
Python 3: dict.iteritems()

Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items(). The Python 3 dict
type has no iteritems() method, the old iteritems() method was
renamed to items().

Change-Id: I16c3dc5d56c074097d7cdda6635796cdc9d851e3

commit_message:
Pass Qualitative Requirements separately in a Request

Add a new 'requirements' parameter to the Nova API for passing in the
qualitative features that are needed for the VM instead of continuing to
stuff those values into a flavor's extra_specs field.

Blueprint: add-qualitative-requirements

Change-Id: I2298b4e991c7eb53eeddf35241dc735f41f34fb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/84/313784/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================================== Pass Qualitative Requirements separately in a Request ===================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-qualitative-requirements This blueprint aims to add a new 'requirements' parameter to the Nova API for passing in the qualitative features that are needed for the VM. Problem description =================== When creating a new VM, the way to specify what you would like in that VM is by specifying the 'flavor' parameter to the Nova API. Flavors are defined combinations of the quantitative aspects of the the host (vCPUs, RAM, disk). In order to specify a qualitative requirement, such as running on a host with a GPU, that must be added to the flavor's `extra_specs` field. With the growth of qualitative features in compute, such as the programmable FPGA, this would cause the number of flavors needed to describe all the possible permutations to grow exponentially. Use Cases --------- As a deployer, I would like to keep the flavors in my system to a manageable number, while still offering my customers all of the latest options. As a user of the cloud, I would like to be able to select what I want without having to wade through a list of hundreds or even thousands of flavors. I'd like to pick the basic size, along with any additional features I might want. Proposed change =============== The code in nova/api will be modified to look in the request body for a 'requirements' key in the server dict, and pass it on to compute in anticipation of modifying the API to include that key. The `build_filter_properties` of scheduler_utils will be modified to accept this new parameter, and add the requirements to the return filter properties, where they will be processed normally by the filters. Once that is in place, the Nova API will be modified (with appropriate microversion) to add a new `requirements` parameter to the request body in the Nova API for creating an instance. Novaclient / openstackclient will also be updated to allow the user to include a new multi-value command line option `--requires` that will specify the required feature. Alternatives ------------ The only other alternative is to contintue packing these things into the flavor's extra_specs, and deal with the resulting exponential growth of flavors. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- This proposal would add an API microversion for the inclusion of a `requirements` key in the request body's `server` dictionary for the Nova API create call. No changes would be made to the response. I'm not sure if this is the correct section, but Horizon will have to be updated to allow users to specify their requirements in addition to picking a flavor. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployers who rely on flavors as a billing unit will now have to take into account the combination of flavor and requested requirements in order to determine pricing. Would appreciate feedback as how to best expose this to make the transition as simple as possible. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: edleafe Other contributors: jaypipes Work Items ---------- 1. Modify the scheduler_utils.build_filter_properties method to accept a `requirements` parameter, and to account for that value when creating the filter_properties value. 2. Modify the nova api to check for body['server']['requirements'], and add that to the scheduler_utils.build_filter_properties call. 3. Create a new microversion that adds the 'requirements' key to the 'server' dict in the request body. 4. Modify novaclient and openstackclient to add a new multi-value `--requires` command-line option that will then be passed as server['requirements']. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Existing tests would have to be updated to account for the new `requirements` param in both the API layers and the scheduler. Documentation Impact ==================== The new API microversion will have to be documented, as well as the user guides for specifying requirements when creating VMs. References ========== None History ======= Optional section for Newton intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/2c34f34ac42991bb2008d1b4518c9f9a431f7d8f', 'message': 'Make our docker-image more user-friendly

- move from ubuntu:14.04 base image to ubuntu:16.04 .
  Ubuntu 16.04 is current/latest LTS release. Let's use it.

- pre-install vim
  It is a "feaute request". Users like to experiment and modify samples
  inside container.

- pre-install bash-completion
  Rally provides bash-completion script, but uit doesn't work without
  installed `bash-completion` package.

- remove '-e' from execution of `echo`.
  This flag is not required, even more it is redundant.

- add sudo rights to rally user
  Rally is a pluggable framework. External plugins can require installation
  of additional python or system packages.

Change-Id: I9540343adbb48fded5531bd3c819396cdb7328df
'}]
commit_message:
Make our docker-image more user-friendly

- move from ubuntu:14.04 base image to ubuntu:16.04 .
  Ubuntu 16.04 is current/latest LTS release. Let's use it.

- pre-install vim
  It is a "feaute request". Users like to experiment and modify samples
  inside container.

- pre-install bash-completion
  Rally provides bash-completion script, but uit doesn't work without
  installed `bash-completion` package.

- remove '-e' from execution of `echo`.
  This flag is not required, even more it is redundant.

- add sudo rights to rally user
  Rally is a pluggable framework. External plugins can require installation
  of additional python or system packages.

Change-Id: I9540343adbb48fded5531bd3c819396cdb7328df

commit_message:
updates default registry tag to latest version

Previously, it was pointing to 2.0.2 and the images built were
with tag 2.0.3. This fix updates the default version to 2.0.3

Closes-Bug: 1605061

Change-Id: I836e553c9054d5ee5948f02c30bdd1324d5c1c73

Use extract_swift_bytes in override_bytes_from_content_type

that once.

Change-Id: I350da34ef7a3cd0cb74f585f4691992ae64c7eab

commit_message:
Add v2/quotas

This adds the quotas api from /admin to /v2 with some changes.

All users can GET /v2/quotas/<project_id>

Users with "All-Projects" permission can view other projects
(by setting X-Auth-All-Projects:True in the HTTP Headers)

Users with "All-Projects" and "set-quotas" can set other
projects quotas

Moved the API rendering to Designate Object based rendering

Change-Id: I7a0b828824ad6f274d922748f5f9a68157cd939a
Depends-On: I06180a7402fc45940d4b312666cf2dfd33af1305
(cherry picked from commit 619b4753cdbbbc9764c86e2d3f9780f48bcb4dd0)

commit_message:
Test constraints for release-notes

Add new job for testing that constraints work with release notes.
This job runs on master, so let's run it directly on xenial.

Change-Id: Iec2af9380534672786ef36fed74b374f99c30859
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/55/344955/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job-template: name: '{name}-releasenotes-test' node: ubuntu-xenial builders: - print-template-name: template-name: "{template-name}" - zuul-git-branch-prep-upper-constraints: branch: master - install-distro-packages - revoke-sudo - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe # # When building the release notes after a patch merges we # always want to build from master. Reno will find release # notes on other branches and insert them into the right # places in the documentation build, but only master has all # of the appropriate branch-specific input files for # Sphinx. The branch-git-prep builder checks out the # repository where the current patch just merged, but it # honors zuul configuration variables that may cause it to # check out a patch merged into a stable branch. So, reset # what we've checked out to master. # git checkout origin/master - tox: envlist: 'releasenotes' publishers: - ftp: site: '{doc-publisher-site}' source: 'releasenotes/build/html/**' target: 'releasenotes/{name}' remove-prefix: 'releasenotes/build/html' excludes: '' - console-log

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 from nodepool

Currently tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 is offline which is causing warnings
in our nodepool logs.  Once tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 is back online we
can revert this commit.

Change-Id: Ia75aed8d511cb2c621a0cd0081c14739e4d4ff79
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

build it to the developer.openstack.org website.

This version of the API reference uses os-api-ref
and compiles API documentation close to that of
the OpenStack compute service (nova).

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>

commit_message:
Migrate API reference into tree

The API Documentation team has requires [1] that
projects maintain their api-reference in-tree and
build it to the developer.openstack.org website.

This version of the API reference uses os-api-ref
and compiles API documentation close to that of
the OpenStack compute service (nova).

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093765.html

Implements: bp move-manila-api-reference-in-tree
Change-Id: I67bb3354162d6e0e00fa2788edde864cc14920ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/74/313874/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. -*- rst -*- ================================================ Share instance export locations (since API v2.9) ================================================ Set of APIs used to view export locations of share instances. By default, these APIs are admin-only. Use the ``policy.json`` file to grant permissions for these actions to other roles. Lists all export locations for a share instance. Show details of an export location belonging to a share instance. List export locations ===================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2/{tenant_id}/share_instances/{share_instance_id}/export_locations Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes: Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - tenant_id: tenant_id - share_instance_id: share_instance_id Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - path: path - share_instance_id: share_instance_id - is_admin_only: is_admin_only - id: id - preferred: preferred Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: samples/manila-export-location-list-response.json :language: javascript Show single export location =========================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2/{tenant_id}/share_instances/{share_instance_id}/export_locations/{export_location_id} Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes: Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - export_location_id: export_location_id - tenant_id: tenant_id - share_instance_id: share_instance_id Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - created_at: created_at - updated_at: updated_at - preferred: preferred - is_admin_only: is_admin_only - share_instance_id: share_instance_id - path: path - id: id Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: samples/manila-export-location-show-response.json :language: javascript

commit_message:
Config consistency: removed checked flags for API

Checked consistency of API options (following [1]) and removed related flags.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ConfigOptionsConsistency

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: If4b43ecab0ab5e42c9b62f14a23598f903843107

commit_message:
Handle diskless hardware connected to remote iscsi

It is required to issue iscsistart -b on those hardware in order for
/dev/sda /dev/sdb etc to be exposed to the OS.

On this type of hw, without the fix
introspection fails with -  missing: ['local_gb']' err.

Change-Id: If6667b123e9b890d97c03612596fb78ee2b0ae85
Closes-Bug: 1590606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/07/327807/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_for_iscsi(): """iscsi detection iscsistart -f will print the iBFT or OF info. In case such connection exists, we would like to issue iscsistart -b to create a session to the target. - if no connection is detected we simply return. """ try: utils.execute('iscsistart', '-f') except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.info('No iscsi connection detected. Skipping iscsi.') return try: utils.execute('iscsistart', '-b') except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.warning('Something went wrong executing iscsistart -b' 'Error: %s', e) _check_for_iscsi()

commit_message:
Squash E006 bashate warnings

bashate, which is invoked when running 'tox -epep8', currently
emits many 'E006: Line too long' warnings.  We apparently don't
really care about line length in shell scripts and ignore these
warnings.

This commit instructs bashate to suppress these warnings so that
we can see any warnings that we really care about.

Change-Id: I565aeaef1f0590e5a6ee6a866974765c748f2965

commit_message:
Add root authority to execute 'ip netns' command

In higher version of kernel, command cannnt be executed correctly
without 'sudo', we'd better add it.

commit_message:
Fix links to network APIs from api-ref

This fixes the direct links to the security groups, security
group rules and floating IPs (layer 3) extensions in the
neutron api-ref.

Part of blueprint deprecate-api-proxies

Change-Id: Ib2c4ed478714b187fde8b7c42da15cc56b26675e

commit_message:
Make it so federated tokens are validated on v2.0

This makes it so that when we validate a fernet federated token against v2.0
and raise an Unauthorized exception.

This is an effort to break https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 into
smaller, more reviewable pieces.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayound@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I321e9e72bb31617b4ecf8ba1e0171dfc099b88c7
Partial-Bug: 1561054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/85/345685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'OS-FEDERATION' in v3_token['user']: msg = _('Unable to validate Federation tokens using the version ' 'v2.0 API.') raise exception.Unauthorized(msg)

subject: Deprecate network quota configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 19:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d0b8fec31d44752393123d544c2458545a31265f', 'message': 'Deprecate network quota configuration

The quota_networks option is only used for the os-tenant-networks
API which only supports CRUD operations for nova-network which
is deprecated, so this change deprecates the quota_networks option.

Furthermore, tenant network quota is disabled by default due to
the enable_network_quota option, so we also deprecate that option
here.

Change-Id: I892855ccf8ae83c0bd5e2bc25ea64dee83ab79ed
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate network quota configuration

The quota_networks option is only used for the os-tenant-networks
API which only supports CRUD operations for nova-network which
is deprecated, so this change deprecates the quota_networks option.

Furthermore, tenant network quota is disabled by default due to
the enable_network_quota option, so we also deprecate that option
here.

Change-Id: I892855ccf8ae83c0bd5e2bc25ea64dee83ab79ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/346996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deprecated_for_removal=True,This option is deprecated since CRUD operations on tenant networks are only available when using nova-network and nova-network is itself disabled. deprecated_for_removal=True,project (or per tenant). This option is deprecated since CRUD operations on tenant networks are only available when using nova-network and nova-network is itself disabled.

commit_message:
Rebase cluster service to resource2/proxy2

This patch rebases the cluster service (senlin) to use resource2 and
proxy2.

Change-Id: Ie6dceb061603d9ced5d26fe2468c42c520aa6d1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/62/344662/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack import resource2 as resource allow_get = True policy_id = resource.Body('policy_id', alternate_id=True) policy_name = resource.Body('policy_name') cluster_id = resource.URI('cluster_id') cluster_name = resource.Body('cluster_name') policy_type = resource.Body('policy_type') is_enabled = resource.Body('enabled', type=bool) data = resource.Body('data', type=dict)
deleted_lines: from openstack import resource id_attribute = 'policy_id' allow_retrieve = True policy_id = resource.prop('policy_id') policy_name = resource.prop('policy_name') cluster_id = resource.prop('cluster_id') cluster_name = resource.prop('cluster_name') policy_type = resource.prop('policy_type') is_enabled = resource.prop('enabled', type=bool) data = resource.prop('data', type=dict)

commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

OpenStack now has dropped support for python 2.6 and lower.
So we don't need to define an assertDictEqual() for python
lower than 2.7.

Further, assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dicts
comparation, just the same as assertDictEqual() in unittest2.
So we do't need to call assertDictEqual() for dicts any more.

Please also refer to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347097/

Change-Id: Ieaf211617c38aa0f9a38625b1009c36bd6a16fba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/08/347208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if tuple(sys.version_info)[0:2] < (2, 7): def assertDictEqual(self, d1, d2, msg=None): # Simple version taken from 2.7 self.assertIsInstance(d1, dict, 'First argument is not a dictionary') self.assertIsInstance(d2, dict, 'Second argument is not a dictionary') if d1 != d2: if msg: self.fail(msg) else: standardMsg = '%r != %r' % (d1, d2) self.fail(standardMsg) TestCase.assertDictEqual = assertDictEqual

commit_message:
Stop checking return of ensure_api_responding

The last commit switched ensure_api_responding from returning True
to returning nothing but create_initial_servers_and_domains is still
gating on the return code of ensure_api_responding before creating
domains so they are never created.

Change-Id: Ib3b1590c2c7b625a88e7dfb1e84183a279830dd6

Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug -- --debug"
to debug test cases when tox is running.

commit_message:
Modified oslo.i18n to 2.1.0

In 2.1.0 oslo.i18n introduced "Support contextual and plural form of
gettext functions" in commit 9e3132bc2f06da87b5c78257a267c5431f433e74.

oslo.i18n's doc also introduce the new two fuctions.[1], and
oslo.service import the two functions(not used), so we need bump
oslo.i18n to 2.1.0.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html#creating-an-integration-module
Closes-bug: #1525992

Change-Id: I318898c651f02d21949e738d690cefce01bfff84

commit_message:
Fix X-*-Container-Update-Override-* header/footer precedence

Previously, all footer overrides (whether from the X-Backend-* or
X-Object-Sysmeta-* namespace) would take priority over any header
override.

However, middleware should be able to set a Sysmeta override without
needing to worry about whether it's working with a replicated policy
(where setting it in headers will suffice) or an EC policy (where it
would need to install a footers callback). This could be mitigated by
*always* installing a footer callback, but doing so would incur
additional overhead that would otherwise be unnecessary.

Change-Id: Idb40361ac72da51e1390dff690723dbc2c653a13

added_lines: def test_PUT_container_override_etag_in_footer(self): ts_iter = make_timestamp_iter() def do_test(override_headers, override_footers): def mock_container_update(ctlr, op, account, container, obj, req, headers_out, objdevice, policy): calls_made.append((headers_out, policy)) calls_made = [] ts_put = next(ts_iter) headers = { 'X-Timestamp': ts_put.internal, 'Content-Type': 'text/plain', 'Transfer-Encoding': 'chunked', 'Etag': 'other-etag', 'X-Backend-Obj-Metadata-Footer': 'yes', 'X-Backend-Obj-Multipart-Mime-Boundary': 'boundary'} headers.update(override_headers) req = Request.blank( '/sda1/p/a/c/o', headers=headers, environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'PUT'}) obj_etag = md5("obj data").hexdigest() footers = {'Etag': obj_etag} footers.update(override_footers) footer_meta = json.dumps(footers) footer_meta_cksum = md5(footer_meta).hexdigest() req.body = "\r\n".join(( "--boundary", "", "obj data", "--boundary", "Content-MD5: " + footer_meta_cksum, "", footer_meta, "--boundary--", )) req.headers.pop("Content-Length", None) with mock.patch( 'swift.obj.server.ObjectController.container_update', mock_container_update): resp = req.get_response(self.object_controller) self.assertEqual(resp.etag, obj_etag) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 201) self.assertEqual(1, len(calls_made)) self.assertEqual({ 'X-Size': str(len('obj data')), 'X-Etag': 'update-etag', 'X-Content-Type': 'text/plain', 'X-Timestamp': ts_put.internal, }, calls_made[0][0]) self.assertEqual(POLICIES[0], calls_made[0][1]) # lone headers/footers work do_test({'X-Backend-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}, {}) do_test({}, {'X-Backend-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}) do_test({'X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}, {}) do_test({}, {'X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}) # footer trumps header do_test({'X-Backend-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'ignored-etag'}, {'X-Backend-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}) do_test({'X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'ignored-etag'}, {'X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}) # but sysmeta header trumps backend footer do_test({'X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'update-etag'}, {'X-Backend-Container-Update-Override-Etag': 'ignored-etag'})

commit_message:
Using LOG.warning replace LOG.warn

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.
Closes-bug:#15229913

Change-Id: Ia5c49fb7ec1327fb995b94844bc548ee9afd3da4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/37/262237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: LOG.warn(_LW("One or more image locations couldn't be scrubbed " "from backend. Leaving image '%s' in 'pending_delete'" " status") % image_id)

commit_message:
BackendException from glancestore causes 500 Error

Location metadata validation is performed in glance store
which is raising BackendExecption if metadata value is not
unicode, dict or list. This exception is not caught in glance
which results in raising 500 error.

Now, when the storage back-end raise BackendException error, Glance
doesn't catch it and raise 500 error. Such as if there is no enough
space for image store, the back-end(Such as Swift) will sometimes
raise a BackendException error.

This patch catch this error when upload image data and update method
and raising HTTPBadRequests to return 400 response to the user.

ApiImpact: For invalid location metadata value 400 response will
           be returned.

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1526641

Change-Id: Ie3916b6818260c66d9ae5de475128a8d21236aa8

added_lines: def test_update_replace_locations_invalid_metadata(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() changes = [{'op': 'replace', 'path': ['locations'], 'value': []}] output = self.controller.update(request, UUID1, changes) self.assertEqual(UUID1, output.image_id) self.assertEqual(0, len(output.locations)) self.assertEqual('queued', output.status) request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() changes = [{ 'op': 'replace', 'path': ['locations'], 'value': [{ 'url': '%s/fake_location' % BASE_URI, 'metadata': { 'fake_metadata': 1234 } }] }] self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, request, UUID1, changes) def test_update_add_locations_invalid_metadata(self): new_location = { 'url': '%s/fake_location' % BASE_URI, 'metadata': { 'fake_metadata': 1234 } } request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() changes = [{'op': 'add', 'path': ['locations', '-'], 'value': new_location}] self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.controller.update, request, UUID1, changes)

commit_message:
Move state reporting initialization to after worker forking

We start state reporting thread before forking child processes. This
leads to possibility of fork in the middle of reporting process. This
can cause child processes to start with corrupted global state. In [0]
it represented itself as metadata agent not being able to make RPC call
because of lock acquired in main process before fork and released after
fork. See bug description for details.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/312393

Partial-Bug: 1594439

Change-Id: Id5079a296bc402c6f5b6cdb2df72811eab5bc6ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/331672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable Horizon Ironic dashboard plugin

Enable the Ironic dashboard plugin if ironic is configured.

Implements: blueprint role-ironic
Change-Id: I4da4720ad3deb587a0131930028f4628a22bb72f

added_lines: - name: Check to see if ironic is configured stat: path=/etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/ironic.yml register: ironic_installed tags: - horizon-configs - name: Enable the horizon-ui-dashboard Horizon panel file: src: "{{ horizon_venv_lib_dir }}/ironic_ui/enabled/_2200_ironic.py" path: "{{ horizon_venv_lib_dir }}/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/_2200_ironic.py" state: "{{ ironic_installed.stat.exists | ternary('link', 'absent') }}" notify: Restart apache2 tags: - horizon-configs

added_lines: from copy import deepcopy elif cls.is_blob_dict(name): if cls.is_blob(name): store_api.delete_blob(blob['url'], context=context) cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, {name: None}) elif cls.is_blob_dict(name): upd_blob = deepcopy(blob) for key, val in six.iteritems(blob): store_api.delete_blob(val['url'], context=context) del upd_blob[key] cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, {name: upd_blob})

commit_message:
Add 'Changes' paragraph to descriptions of some murano packages

After commits [*] names of some murano packages were changed.
The patch adds a new paragraph to description of these packages
to let users know about these changes.

* I2e00a8b0cfd301c424a97c4cfaabd643b804566e
* I84a257898d74494c1e9915ff671c6fb3b6e050f1
* If8e63ce5abf980972ea9cae6d28283180be706e9
* I825c9acac4693c53a053058e389884dfe9166569
* Ic75f11b209d47d3954f24e0b60acdb4b85f2dbf4

Change-Id: I8419e880b4db2727b93df6cb6bc8772ab1e4e971

commit_message:
Use "openstack console url show" to replace "nova get-vnc-console"

The "get-vnc-console" is not complete, this patch use
"openstack console url show" to replace the not complete command.

Change-Id: Iaaf03aff0d6609b97d0af7073ce859019c3fd89e

commit_message:
Add test for nova-compute and nova-network main database blocks

We block the database objects when conductor is not local for compute
and network, but we don't test this code anywhere because it's in the
main() function of the actual executable.

Fix that.

Change-Id: I5b9343d30e6b4aedb05f0731ba9bdca51d408ba9

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from nova.cmd import compute from nova.cmd import network from nova import db from nova import exception from nova import test class ComputeMainTest(test.NoDBTestCase): @mock.patch('nova.utils.monkey_patch') @mock.patch('nova.conductor.api.API.wait_until_ready') @mock.patch('oslo_reports.guru_meditation_report') def _call_main(self, mod, gmr, cond, patch): @mock.patch.object(mod, 'config') @mock.patch.object(mod, 'service') def run_main(serv, conf): mod.main() run_main() def test_compute_main_blocks_db(self): self._call_main(compute) self.assertRaises(exception.DBNotAllowed, db.api.instance_get, 1, 2) def test_network_main_blocks_db(self): self._call_main(network) self.assertRaises(exception.DBNotAllowed, db.api.instance_get, 1, 2)

config options: improve help for notifications

This patch improves help text for notifications related configuration options.

Implements blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I261921a4fc534eef73ee57b980e5d524a32eacd9

added_lines: ALL_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('notify_on_state_change', choices=(None, 'vm_state', 'vm_and_task_state'), help=""" If set, send compute.instance.update notifications on instance state changes. Valid values are None for no notifications, "vm_state" for notifications on VM state changes, or "vm_and_task_state" for notifications on VM and task state changes. Possible values: * None - no notifications * "vm_state" - notifications on VM state changes * "vm_and_task_state" - notifications on VM and task state changes Services that use this: * None Related options: * None """), cfg.BoolOpt('notify_api_faults', default=False, help=""" If set, send api.fault notifications on caught exceptions in the API service. Possible values: * True, False (default) Services that use this: * None Related options: * None """), cfg.StrOpt('default_notification_level', default='INFO', choices=('DEBUG', 'INFO', 'WARN', 'ERROR', 'CRITICAL'), help=""" Default notification level for outgoing notifications. Possible values: * "INFO" * "DEBUG" * "WARN" * "ERROR" * "CRITICAL" Services that use this: * None Related options: * None """), cfg.StrOpt('default_publisher_id', help=""" Default publisher_id for outgoing notifications. Possible values: * String with valid IP address. Default is IPv4 address of this host. Services that use this: * ``None`` Related options: * None """), ]
deleted_lines: notify_on_state_change = cfg.StrOpt('notify_on_state_change', help='If set, send compute.instance.update notifications on instance ' 'state changes. Valid values are None for no notifications, ' '"vm_state" for notifications on VM state changes, or ' '"vm_and_task_state" for notifications on VM and task state ' 'changes.') notify_api_faults = cfg.BoolOpt('notify_api_faults', default=False, help='If set, send api.fault notifications on caught exceptions ' 'in the API service.') default_notification_level = cfg.StrOpt('default_notification_level', default='INFO', choices=('DEBUG', 'INFO', 'WARN', 'ERROR', 'CRITICAL'), help='Default notification level for outgoing notifications') default_publisher_id = cfg.StrOpt('default_publisher_id', help='Default publisher_id for outgoing notifications') ALL_OPTS = [notify_on_state_change, notify_api_faults, default_notification_level, default_publisher_id]

commit_message:
virt/hardware: Add diagnostic logs for scheduling

There are many reasons why booting a pinned instance can fail. Expose
some of these reasons to operators via the logs.

Change-Id: Id99cca56df93573b0a0a192cbaf198d059c78e88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/285322/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Host does not have any fully free thread sibling sets.' 'It is not possible to emulate a non-SMT behavior ' 'for the isolate policy without this.') if host_cell.avail_cpus < len(instance_cell.cpuset): LOG.debug('Not enough available CPUs to schedule instance. ' 'Oversubscription is not possible with pinned instances. ' 'Required: %(required)s, actual: %(actual)s' % {'required': len(instance_cell.cpuset), 'actual': host_cell.avail_cpus}) return if host_cell.avail_memory < instance_cell.memory: LOG.debug('Not enough available RAM to schedule instance. ' 'Oversubscription is not possible with pinned instances. ' 'Required: %(required)s, actual: %(actual)s' % {'required': instance_cell.memory, 'actual': host_cell.memory}) if instance_cell.memory > host_cell.memory: LOG.debug('Not enough host RAM to schedule instance. Required: ' '%(required)s, actual: %(actual)s' % {'required': instance_cell.memory, 'actual': host_cell.memory}) return if len(instance_cell.cpuset) > len(host_cell.cpuset): LOG.debug('Not enough host CPUs to schedule instance. Required: ' '%(required)s, actual: %(actual)s' % {'required': len(instance_cell.cpuset), 'actual': len(host_cell.cpuset)}) return # No need to log here - it's handled further down if memory_usage > ram_limit: LOG.debug('Host has limitations on usable RAM. There is not ' 'enough free RAM to schedule this instance. Usage: ' '%(usage)s, limit: %(limit)s' % {'usage': memory_usage, 'limit': ram_limit}) return if cpu_usage > cpu_limit: LOG.debug('Host has limitations on usable RAM. There is not ' 'enough free RAM to schedule this instance. Usage: ' '%(usage)s, limit: %(limit)s' % {'usage': memory_usage, 'limit': ram_limit}) return LOG.debug('Instance requested hugepages but host topology does ' 'not provide them.')
deleted_lines: if (host_cell.avail_cpus < len(instance_cell.cpuset) or host_cell.avail_memory < instance_cell.memory): # If we do not have enough CPUs available or not enough memory # on the host cell, we quit early (no oversubscription). if (instance_cell.memory > host_cell.memory or len(instance_cell.cpuset) > len(host_cell.cpuset)): return None if memory_usage > ram_limit or cpu_usage > cpu_limit: return None

commit_message:
Revert "[networking-guide]A grammar error in networking-guide"

This change incorrectly modified an existing correct plural usage of
infrastructure into an incorrect attempt as "infrastructures."

This reverts commit f19141b9b16cf4a37a2044000d5ff1dfd2e403f7.

Change-Id: I5d9f725f60c8762017107ef55398b844efa9dec0
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Fix wrong licenses for fuel-release and fuel-setup subpackages

Licenses for these two packages were set to GPLv2 for no apparent
reason. Align the licenses for subpackages with the fuel-main
package license.

Change-Id: Id8dd332216c91cc1f122db5c27a87bae0d4db18d
Closes-Bug: #1597696
(cherry picked from commit db63658d12d849f3b04b8d62c9f4e8c5d4411fb0)

commit_message:
[config-ref] skip options marked as disable

The common configurations are described in the common
configurations table. The corresponding configutations
at each table are not necessary.

Change-Id: Ied2d03d1c7f71f5712fcf57d4499e127db327b7d
Implements: blueprint config-ref-common-sections

commit_message:
Fix opt description and check deprecate status for hyperv.py

Removed the "Services which consume this:" sections per wiki
instructions.  Also removed the "Related options" sections
where there are no information.

Also, since there are no deprecated options the
"check_deprecation_status" flag has been removed as well.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I08e1bfaa54795558082bbfcfbfe6d22542d873ec

commit_message:
Add release note for extra LXC command options

This adds a release note for https://review.openstack.org/344262

Change-Id: I40d07239d7369ac2af74426dcaa31530ef0591fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create refs/changes/35/347235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The ``lxc-container-create`` role now consumes the variable ``lxc_container_config_list`` which should contain a list of the entries which should be added to the LXC container config file when the container is created. This feature is designed to be used in group_vars to ensure that containers are fully prepared at the time they are created, thus cutting down the number of times containers are restarted during deployments and upgrades.

commit_message:
Allow extra LXC command options via group/host vars

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch implements the facility to consume
LXC container_command items from the inventory.

This allows any arbitrary command, such as the creation of a bind
mount directory, to be set in group_vars and therefore have it
applied on container creation instead of later when the service
install playbook runs.

Change-Id: I2aa015a136d6efca501797430d82f1461c303edf

added_lines: The default value is good for most deployments. The default value is rarely need to be changed. As soon as we will be closer to feature parity more and more deployers can set it to 'versioned' as the whole infrastructure moves towards consuming the new notifications. After that, the choice "unversioned" doesn't make sense anymore and this option will be removed (possibly in the "P" release). The list of versioned notifications is visible in
deleted_lines: Currently there is no feature parity between unversioned and versioned notifications. If the deployment needs the full range of legacy notifications then the recommended setting is 'both' or 'unversioned'. Nova does not allow adding new legacy notifications so new notification will be emitted as versioned notifications. If the deployment needs the new notifications then either 'both' or 'versioned' value is required. The list of versioned notifications is visible inNova is planning to deprecate this parameter as soon as feature parity is achieved. This is an advanced option, deployers rarely needs to change the default value.

commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by
using != operator to compare two dicts. So is
assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual() in
testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and
so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: Ice343b2ce468acae39d2ad79f7121503e3627656

commit_message:
Use pop instead del

For example:resp.pop(a,None), when a is in resp, resp will delete key and value
of a. When a is not in resp, None is returned.

Change-Id: I12892e6dc8b37fe49e9ec8cbeadab219793a25e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/62/347162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp.headers.pop(key, None)
deleted_lines: if key in resp.headers: del resp.headers[key]

commit_message:
update docs for sphinxconfiggen

We landed the feature to let the sphinx integration work with multiple
input and output files, but we didn't update the docs for it.

Change-Id: I1ef3f91aed3bdbcfdff4f8afc5fa325b34008495
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Allow shell class to be overridden in test subclass

osc_lib.utils.TestShell may be subclassed in other modules to test
osc_lib.shell.OpenStackShell subclasses.  Set the shell class to be
tested by setting TestShell.shell_class_path to the full class path.

Change-Id: I0ab187d370ebb28760d90a8aca4b64eea19c8d9e

commit_message:
Fix parameters of assertEqual are misplaced

Many assertEqual sentences don't follow assertEqual(expected, actual),
These misplaces have 2 impacts:
1, giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2, mislead other developers, new test modules may follow these wrong pattern.

This patch fix all of them.

Change-Id: Icc6e404dd02fe47b76c7366d31d91c8d8e464f54
Closes-Bug: #1604213

commit_message:
Added an automaticget token plug-ins.

  Getting token is a necessary action, so an automatic get token
  plug-ins should be integrated into heatclient.
  Old API still used:
   >> heat = Client(version, endpoint=heat_url, token=auth_token)
  Youcan get a token automaticllynow:
   >> heat = Client(version, username='username', password='password',
   endpoint=heat_url, auth_url='auth_url')

Change-Id: Ic33303b8d41a84542b38cc51963ff2abb84adcbc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/53/274553/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time import contextlib @contextlib.contextmanager def record_time(times, enabled, *args): """Record the time of a specific action. :param times: A list of tuples holds time data. :type times: list :param enabled: Whether timing is enabled. :type enabled: bool :param *args: Other data to be stored besides time data, these args will be joined to a string. """ if not enabled: yield else: start = time.time() yield end = time.time() times.append((' '.join(args), start, end))

commit_message:
Port guestagent test_dbaas to Python 3

* Use encodeutils.exception_to_unicode() to get the message of
  exceptions. On Python 3, the message attribute of exceptions has
  been removed.
* NamedTemporaryFile: open files in text mode, not in binary mode.
* test_dbaas: set rowcount in execute() mocks to avoid comparison
  with a mock which now raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* replace "rowcount <= limit" with
  "limit is not None and rowcount <= limit" to avoid comparison
  between int and None (TypeError on Python 3)
* Replace urllib.quote() with six.moves.urllib.parse.quote
* blacklist-py3.txt: remove guestagent.test_dbaas to run it
  on Python 3

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: Ibdd34485ce4f2fb3572dcd7f57cbf9e5b6f42a13

Fix some network methods

subnet() method of netaddr.IPNetwork want new network cidr by second argument. Also move from ipaddr to netaddr.

Change-Id: I3a441530796fdce88c761380084566426fb885cd
Closes-Bug: #1571543

rest: enable CORS middleware without Paste

It's impossible to pass a ConfigObj via Paste, so let's just embed it in
our application directly.

commit_message:
Fixes unclear error when no --pool-prefix given

--pool-prefix is required on subnetpool creation.
refactor: removed unused 'for_create' argument in
add_updatable_arguments in subnetpool module.
Closes-bug: #1536479

Change-Id: I79573369cb95c0b090e9ebfea9af40485d968e2f
(cherry-picked from commit 37ec942417c77b3104ff69a8b33a5549fb3d0c98)

support event logs for CLI

display that nicely. so implemented ability to make dump
with full event log details

commit_message:
Remove unhelpful test of oslo.service ServiceLauncher

Change https://review.openstack.org/315498 was rushed in to fix the
gate breakage, but reviewers correctly noted that the test does not
belong in Neutron.

Change-Id: I25426aae53932459d732ba560733f04d70ea03ac
(cherry picked from commit 0d837a4be245f6024a6b26727c7c7c0edc6029c5)

commit_message:
Configure memcached use with new settings in [cache] section

Some components like the vnc console make use of a shared cache to share
auth tokens between the controllers.  This makes a shared cache a kind of
requirement for these features to correctly work.  The configuration of
memcached servers has changed from the deprecated memcached_servers setting
in [DEFAULT] to several settings in the [cache] section.  This patch sets
these settings in order to make sure a shared cache is used.

Change-Id: I45abf7b5f83522bfc7f593726da7f3bc1646f8eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/29/342829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
objects: Add update_fields method in base class.

For usage convenience, add in base class update_fields method. This would
handle the updating of allowed fields, leaving the fields_no_update without
modification.

Usage of update_fields for SubnetPool integration in db_base_plugin_v2 and
for trunk plugin update_trunk.

Change-Id: Ia1fb22e75d71b1baf1b4a8fed1b185c250a41c1c
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Executor fails actions if they are redelivered

With this change executor will fail actions that are redelivered
and have flag safe_rerun set to false

Implements blueprint mistral-task-delivery-model

Change-Id: Ie0e728cf59af9fe44c8fd1d243439a82d9478ff4

commit_message:
Add information about using file based sqlite for unit tests

This is helpful when you want to inspect the database when sitting at
a break-point in a unit test.

Change-Id: Id4e25ef980437fe160822c3598135aa220127ac8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/346955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: You can get oslo.db to generate a file-based sqlite database by setting OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION to a file based URL as described in `this mailing list post`__. This file will be created but (confusingly) won't be the actual file used for the database. To find the actual file, set a break point in your test method and inspect self.engine.url. __ file-based-sqlite_ .. code-block:: shell $ OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=sqlite:///sqlite.db .tox/py27/bin/python -m \ testtools.run neutron.tests.unit... ... (Pdb) self.engine.url sqlite:////tmp/iwbgvhbshp.db Now, you can inspect this file using sqlite3. .. code-block:: shell $ sqlite3 /tmp/iwbgvhbshp.db .. _file-based-sqlite: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099861.html

commit_message:
Add a new test 'cli_selected_nodes_deploy'

- Add a test that creates a cluster and deploy nodes using
only Fuel CLI.

- for tests cli_cluster_deletion and cli_node_deletion_check
changed dependence on test group from 'prepare_ha_neutron'
to 'cli_selected_nodes_deploy'

- Move 'hiera_deploy' test to a separate class:
'command_line_minimal', because it is used on different CI
(see bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1425464)

Change-Id: Ie3c833ccee8ee1e9cae16e9386ad5369dbbf96e8
Related-Bug:#1448977
